This year, we decided to go for breakfast, and boy and I glad we did!   The food is always good at T Cooks. We've enjoyed dinner here a couple times and they always treat you nicely and make a special occasion even more special. So, our breakfast was great. I had the croissant sandwich and my Husband had the pesto omelet. He LOVED the pesto flavor in his omelet, as well as the english muffin it came with and the apple cinnamon jam. It really was fabulous. My croissant sandwich was to die for. I loved how they mixed the cheese in the eggs and the eggs were cooked just right - not overdone.   The waitress was so nice, she noticed it was my Husband's bday and brought him a plate that said "happy birthday" and had some truffles.   Love, Love, Love T Cooks and Royal Palms - you must go!

h0DTOkWwBm0h9px_Q6UeAA.text: By far THE best cucumber martini around. Very light & fresh. The only thing that would make it better is if they would put a thin slice of cucumber on top instead of a wedge of lime.

THqpVMnFx2L-Ug35WcUqrA.text: Today was my third visit to the restaurant. Today is also the first time in my life I left an establishment after being seated. If I were alone, I'd be probably waiting for service still. But it was my mother's birthday, so after waiting to be seated in a line of elderly people and getting absolute zero attention after 20 minutes at the table, we all got up and left. The food there is good, if somewhat old-fashioned. The service is anywhere from poor to absent.

FsulPqrkWrsdGZu0gEc8XQ.text: We were visiting an old friend in Scottsdale who recommended we meet here for dinner. When we arrived we were informed by the valet that the restaurant was closed for remodeling, but that they had set up a temporary location in another space.We weren't sure what to expect, but I'm so glad we decided to stay and give it a try! The location they were using was absolutely charming. Our waiter was so attentive and engaging. The food was beautifully prepared and plated. We each ordered a different entree and they were all excellent. This is definitely a restaurant I would return to.

LBIqHT--H_ZUDbT_DT2khw.text: This is only for the bar.  I have been here twice now while visiting, and service is superb.  The bottled beer list has some unique options; if they had a couple of these on tap, I would give five stars.  In talking to Joe the bartender, we learned that the majority of their employees havebeen working at T. Cooks for years. . .like 5, 8, 13 years??!!!  This speaks really well for the place.  It is a romantic spot for a drink or a snack.  The venue is lovely.  If I lived here, I would probably try out HH and love it.

gHSsm_BPtT3-_gBV_xqFeg.text: Don't bother.  Overpriced, immemorable food served by a creepy waiter.  AND he didn't bother to tell me when I asked for water for the table that it would be $6 a bottle!!!!    Yuck to the whole experience here.

zoy28cyonCiYNN1JVMkX7Q.text: I remembered I loved the atmosphere here so I tried it again.   I went with a group of three others.  This time, the food was better than I had remembered.   But there were two hiccups that come to mind.  The first hiccup was at the beginning of the evening when we arrived 15 mins before our reservation to be told that there would be a wait because a very large group came before us.  Hey, I didn't really mind because as a matter of fact, we were early.    However, we sat in the lounge/bar and spent close to 40 dollars on four glasses of what was a very poor imitation of sangria.  Having been to Spain and having had the legit, elixir of the gods, that even non-drinkers have been known to fall in love with, I didn't expect as much.  But then again, I didn't expect Hi-C Fruit Punch.    20 mins AFTER our reservation time, we were seated...   But from then on, everything was pretty much smooth sailing.    We ordered the sweetbreads & bone marrow, escargot, antipasto plate, and the mussels for appetizer courses.  Antipasto plate was awesome, lots of different things to nibble on and share with others.    Mussels were good and the portions were big, considering this was a "fancy" restaurant where portions tend to be miniature servings.  I can't remember if it came with bread or if we used the bread from the antipasto plate or house bread that came, but we were all sloppin' up the juice from the mussels!  Escargot... Usually served either in a unique dish that holds the individual shells and you pop them out with a miniature fork; or cooked together with other ingredients but still in its shell.  At T. Cook's, they do all the work for you, serving the snails out of its shell cooked with the other ingredients... It was good, but I didn't like that it took the "special" out of a typical escargot dish.  It's like going to eat crabs and all the meat was already picked out for you...  Or sunflower seeds already out of its shell...  The sweetbreads and marrow dish really sucked the last time I came here but ordered it anyways because there really aren't many chances to order this type of "offal" dish in Arizona.  This time, it really was good.  Very well prepared and delish!  However, we were wondering what sweetbreads were called in Spanish.  We got our young Hispanic waiter who spoke Spanish by the way and asked him.  I'm not fluent, but hearing "pan" and "dulce" were not what I was expecting... I was like "Uhmmm... Excuse me, this isn't bread..."  He was "It's not like a bread pieces glazed with a sweet sauce?"  I had to pull out my phone and look it up.  Holy moly!  A waiter who doesn't even know what he's serving?  Is that acceptable T. Cooks???   By the way, sweetbreads are Molleja in Spanish.  We also had 4 soups or salads, 4 entrees, and 4 desserts; nothing really outstanding or super memorable from what I remember.  Along with a 50 dollar-ish bottle of wine, our bill was around 410 without tip.

sJ7HPU6iAaVdDOl2YkEjyg.text: The white corn bisque was one of the best bisque I've ever had. Their staff is very friendly and are very nice and make sure everything is ok. All in all a excellent restaurant  that I would go to again.

gtovCLrzqTGD6zgI1W9goA.text: Korey K. Was incredibly responsive. Fantastic server! Great dinner as usual at T.Cook's.

1ZfQDGMdYfonpf3CX7zUXw.text: My fiance took me here to celebrate after he won a poker tournament. He wanted an intimate/romantic dinner to celebrate so we glamoured up thinking this was going to be a very dressy kind of place. We were wrong. Upon walking into the restaurant we felt very overdressed in my cocktail dress and he in his newly bought suit. Most of the people dining there were in summer shorts and polos. Looked more like they were dressed to go golfing! Regardless, we greatly enjoyed our romantic dinner. The lights in the dining area were dim and wasn't loud at all. It was the perfect intimate setting.  We shared a pear salad and crab cake to start with. The salad left a little to be desired, but the crab cake was DELICIOUS! For the entree he had the beef tenderloin and I had the salmon. He won that choice! We shared the Raspberry Charlotte for desset. It was absolutely out of this world! Probably one of the best desserts I've ever had. The portion was huge, we could barely finish it between the two of us.  The waiter was VERY attentive and friendly. He made great recommendations on food and wine (which paired perfectly with our meal) and we didnt feel rushed at all between courses. He cleared our plates diligently after we finished each meal and always carefully whipped our table before bringing out the next course. Best service we've ever had at a restaurant!  After we finished our dinner we walked around in the courtyard for a bit. It was beautiful! The trees were decorated in lights and the fountains were on and lit which created a romantic setting for us two love birds. We'll definitely be back!

hcEMCOWTuqR0l6Ahj4R3Aw.text: Beautiful place, romantic ambience!  Food, not so much.  Rib ravioli was a bit dry when u first bite into it.  The carbonara dish was so rich yet nothing special in terms of flavor profile at all.  Maybe it's better to only have a drink there in stead of a big meal.

cmJ7Mw7DTZo61uBfjoOycw.text: My father was getting married at Royal Palms so T cooks seemed like a good idea. We made reservations but needed two extra seats when I explained this the the host they were rude as hell acting like it was the end of the damn world . We spent well over 900 bucks but ended up having to sit way across from each other because we were in two separate tables. Ruined my night food was just ok not worth the price but the waiter was a sweet guy.. I'll never return no thanks

dCMC-gVMvBGkSXSTJ7v-0w.text: This review would be for the lounge only.  I found out they offer Taco Tuesday here and I was in like so fast. For $2 I got a tostada thing with shredded tenderloin that was oh so tender with a deep fried egg and some jalapeno sauce.  the service was spot on, they have the most delicious iced tea ever, and it's a beautiful place.

zhAMWd-TIsRl-cK0YYivxg.text: My twin aunts had a surprise dinner celebrating their 60th birthday at T Cook's.  I was not able to make it to the dinner celebration, so I decided to send them a bottle of Champaign for this special occasion.  The restaurant manager, Christian, was amazing.  He patiently answered my questions on the phone and by emails.  He assured me that the dinner party would be well taken care of.  My aunts and uncles had a marvelous time the whole evening.  All I heard were praises about the good time they had at the restaurant.  One of my aunts posted a comment on facebook, "The service at the restaurant was superb. A big shout-out to Jeff, our waiter and the employees at the Palm Resort, who were also in on the plan."  One of my uncle also posted, "We had a wonderful dinner, then we went into the bar and there was a duo playing so we danced until the band packed up and left. It turned out to be a magical evening."    Thank you for wonderful service.  You guys are awesome!  Please continue to be the stars you are at the restaurant.

HAp-2zOy4o14fethk3PuqQ.text: The short of it:  Delicious, high-quality food; high prices; and a nice atmosphere, if a bit "hoity-toity".   The stuffiness comes along with the prices, the clientele who can afford said prices, the wine sales push, and the insistence on repeatedly calling me "Mister L." (which felt odd considering my relative youth). Aside from that, a pleasant experience for an early dinner.  Highlights included the antipasto platter with lots of things made in-house; the mixed greens salad (complete with a goat cheese tart!); and a pair of decadent desserts (who knew what guava could do for a creme brulee). The paella (a T. Cooks signature) was surprisingly just "good" (which says something of otherwise high standard) - the seafood was fresh and the dish was big enough to serve three, but it was quite salty. The other three people in my party, though, had no such complaints about their entrees.

w6jFIDNbyYR5CEeBQrz9_g.text: This is one of the better restaurants in the Phoenix valley.  Not only great food, service and decor, but also a great resort to walk around with mature landscaping that is worth the tour.    The service was top notch, and the food was excellent.  This is a great venue for date night, or for a group gathering as a special event.  There was no rushing from the service and the food delivery was right on from appetizers through desert.  I would highly recommend this restaurant and hotel.

UxgXdgiWv43pyom4Sev81A.text: For a special night, this is a great place.  Great seating, inside an out, very romantic. I have to be honest, food was better than good, but not great, but you wont be disappointed.  The vibe and service makes it stand as a super choice to make yourself feel good.

YyfXj5DhTIPTrtwnv2Ghqg.text: Had dinner here on valentines 1 year ago, this restaurant is very fancy but being that it was valentines , we had a fixed price menu which we really didn't like, overall it was very nice and ambience is romantic , however my sea bass was undercooked and it took too long to get service, maybe because it was a busy day and they were understaffed. Highlight of the night was definitely the dessert , their caramel crime brulee is like nothing I've tried before, it was the best I ever had, and typically I'm not a big fan of crime brulee, but I just couldn't resist!!! It was pricy but I could see why, the place was very nice but I wasn't too impressed with dinner so i probably will not be returning to this restaurant!

VbgtfNYYTWdaBMyDZ3QVKQ.text: This is probably the best formal dinner in Phoenix- if you are willing to drop a lot of . The service is excellent with tips about each and every item on the menu. Personally, I went on the New Years special, which had good food, and many options to choose from- saying it was a "special" menu.   The complimentary pesto and bread is amazing- try it! The Hershey Kisses in the front are also perfect for the kids! LOL. Which brings me to kids... there are very little, if not, no kids at this restaurant. Little heads up parents!   To wrap it up, T Cooks is perfect if you are trying to find a chill typical American restaurant with excellent service. But, just expect the bill to "wow" you!

RBPWDlrpocR43-RDHXlSWA.text: Our dinner with some local friends was overall spectacular!  I shared my husband's rib eye with mashed potatoes and green beans which was perfection!  Also, serving size for my small appetite was perfect for us.  Our friends had the lamb chops which they enjoyed without an offer of a taste and the bass without any offering of taste because it was so delicious! Best part of the experience was our discreet, charming server, Sasha.  He was helpful, entertaining and made our visit extraordinary!   I can only hope we return next year to get our wonderful sanctuary of healing and kindness.

pQNAw2bBtjoDS_AxAFNQ6Q.text: My family and I ate at T Cook's on Christmas Day, Excited to spend the Day with family eating what we thought was to be a delectable delight! We ordered from the Fixed Menu. To our dismay: My steak was served cold, potatoes were cold completely not edible. My daughter's fish was very fishy tasting and smelly... Not edible.  Instead of the Manager taking the dishes away and making sure we were not charged for the disgusting meal he comped our wine... Which was not any compensation for the meal we never had.. We've been going to the Royal Palms for 21 years. My husband and I were the first ones to get married when the remodeling was going on. The Property is a special place for us, but for the last couple of years T 'Cook's has been so disappointing. We thought with the new owners we would be pleasantly surprised. Not So.... Joni

xXKiecxR1GXae2ZB5-rSrA.text: Came here for breakfast for several days since we were staying at the hotel.  Huevos Rancheros 5/5 was my favorite! Instead of beans I substituted it with hash browns - delicious!  Eggs Benedict was very good too.  Beautiful atmosphere with a gorgeous setting - camelback mountain in the back. When the weather is nice, sit outside.  Ask the waiter for the juice of the day - not listed on menu. Today's was melon, blueberry, and pear. Others in the past include bell pepper, Apple, and carrot.

photos.caption: Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict
Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huevos Rancheros - delicious!

5UHJ-qiGDR0WEyKzguI2EA.text: Just one of the best restaurants in Arizona. Great fish and wonderful service. Kudos!

tsOJFxKJkV5M5EWCY8HFGg.text: Favorite restaurant in all of Arizona! Friendly staff, beautiful setting and the food is exceptional! Highly recommend!

yleFtKTsU7W7cAgUMsx45A.text: Award Winning Dining at it's finest!  Took an out of town friend for lunch and it was as delicious as always.  I keep going back.  Whether it's Sunday Brunch, Lunch or Dinner, the experience is amazing?

UwkyPkNN2hStO-VKKfsRaw.text: The food here is LEGIT!!!  We had the Chef's Selection. EVERY single bite was dreamy.  The Foie Gras (duck liver) was amazing. The flavor was just so good.   two HUGE thumbs up!

OCFaCp1J6wT7M1av5QzK6Q.text: Came here for a working lunch.  I had the T.COOK'S BURGER which has red onion and bacon aioli, cave aged white cheddar, arugula, brioche bun.  This was a delicious burger and the fries was cooked perfectly.  The atmosphere here is wonderful and would make for a great date night location. There is even a tree growing through the place! Check it out you will not be disappointed.

XxDn3uUqonx17buelCRS9A.text: Went here for Valentine's Day and it was amazing. Michael was our server and he blew us away. He was quick to answer questions and knew what he was talking about. He made sure we were having a good time and was very personable. It made the whole experience that much better. We will definitely be back and be requesting him as our server.

6JbXHbukksMrYPsfNjTdZw.text: Even though we have eaten here a few times over the years and always had a wonderful experience... We tend to forget how great it is! And what a shame because T Cooks really is a gem. You can't go wrong no matter how you dine here. The bar has a great atmosphere, inventive cocktails and the gourmet popcorn is addictive. Dinner is an elegant atmosphere you can still feel comfortable in and nothing compares to their signature pesto that comes with the bread. Even breakfast here this morning was healthy but totally satisfying. Our server Tanino met my every (probably annoying!) request with a great alternative suggestion that made my meal even better - no bread under your eggs Benedict? How about spinach? He was awesome.   Thanks for being such a consistent and classy operation T Cooks.

photos.caption: Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My husband enjoying the Ultimate Bloody Mary

WUiblPg5yd1Y7tupkZVhQA.text: Friends off ours asked if we would like to go to T Cook's Sunday Brunch their treat! WoW. Best part of the meal was the time we shared with our friends. The meal was good also but you can't beat being with friends.  Our reservation was for 11:15. We were seated soon after we arrived. Had a choice of inside or outside. We chose inside and outside would of been a realistic choice since we was having great weather. If you have not been to the Royal Palms resort, it is really a nice place to visit for a meal, stay at the resort?  When you pull in you will be in a small circle area where the only parking is valet. We were greeted and relieved or our car keys. The valet is free, tips appreciated.  As I said we were seated and explained how the buffet worked. The food was good and of a high quality. Beacon was twice the thickness of most places. Eggs to order and anything you could think of was provided, many items you would never of thought of. Shrimp that was 3/4 inches thick and 3 inches long of more, crab claws pealed and ready to pick the meat and eat.  Many types of bread along with all the toppings. The offerings was endless. Much to much for me to remember and write down.  All you can eat means all you can eat. Not that you should eat all you can eat. I know I had more that I should of eaten. We had a great meal and better conservation with our friends. This was a real treat.  Now my only criticism is this. Yes we were there longer than most, but the room always had 10 or so empty tables and we felt comfortable sitting and enjoying each others company. It was obvious they wanted us to go as they kept coming by asking if they could clean the table, need carry out box, and finally a rude suggestion that it was time to go. If the room had been packed I could understand, maybe.. The meal was good the company was better, the customer service could use some work.

AYslsE1o7gmL0opjP2xHJg.text: Good American Restaurant at Royal palm Resort and spa in scottsdale, AZ. We have a good time here with very nice foods and Cocktail. Also we stay here too. Everything so good. If you come to scottsdale you have to stay here.

photos.caption: Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

zSCauYNKSvplAWP03nYeNA.text: The resort its self is beautiful, no doubt about that! After hearing some positive reviews on T. Cooks we decided to try it out. Mistake one, we made a reservation before 10am on Sunday. Several workers were walking around preparing for their brunch rush, understandably so, but what about the people dinning? There was only one server working at the time, she seemed overwhelmed working a rather large area with tables scattered. We weren't in a rush so the service wasn't an inconvenience to us, but I would have liked more interaction and insight on the menu. We both ordered the Mediterranean Eggs Benedict. For being on their menu for 18+ years, I was underwhelmed. My poached eggs were cooked all the way through and the hollandaise sauce was a very generous amount for the dish.  Overall, the service and food won't have me returning for more.

eJwPxL0fDGWoTceWNUV_6g.text: Great service!! Fantastic food, amazing hand crafted cocktails, and Ian makes the best pasta

wEiusejjz7Yqz1nfuIR2mA.text: This negative review is not because of the quality of the food. I would give the food a 4, and the service, a negative 2. We made a reservation for my wife's big birthday year, and got dressed up for the occasion. This place is supposed to be known as one of those places to go when it's a special occasion.  The waiter seemed like a good guy until he got lost sometime after placing the food order. He literally did not show up again until the plates were being carried away by the assistant-- we had no check-in's (not one) from the time we ordered our meal until the plates were taken away, and the restaurant was not all that busy. It was very surprising to us. But because the food was generally good, we let it slide and didn't get our feathers ruffled. I wanted to ask him a question or two, but we made it through the meal just fine without him.   When I ordered my food, I made a very large point about an allergy. I have to make that clear, as I have a four-alarm allergy to eggs. I literally can't be anywhere near an egg (my eyes turn bright red if someone's cooking something with eggs on the microwave and I walk through the kitchen). So, no problems developed with eggs during the meal. When we did see the waiter again later, it was a big push for desserts. They knew at the hostess stand and in my OpenTable reservation that it was my wife's birthday, so we were surprised when he came out with a desert and two spoons on a plate that said Happy Anniversary. Oops.   But it was this dessert that did me in. He had placed a spoon right down in front of me, and he knew about my egg allergy. But just in case, I asked him again "Hey, what is this dessert anyway? Would it have eggs?" and he replied "I have no idea what's in that glass, they always have something different for us. At least you could eat the chocolate and whipped cream off the top!"   Sort of a dumb comment. Most restaurants, if it were truly an anniversary (and ours wasn't, it was my wife's birthday) would provide me with a sorbet or something eggless and allow my wife to enjoy the original item. In this case, he just walked away and did what he does best -- disappear. I took his advice and took the chocolate off the top of the treat.  Within moments, I had to rush and vomit up my $60 meal because that wasn't chocolate, and that wasn't whipped cream on top. It was pure egg white of some kind, and that ruined the evening for both of us. Nothing was adjusted, no apology from the waiter -- NOT AT ALL. Mentioned it to the hostess on the way out, no rush to get a manager, etc. This place could care less. They've been there for so long, they've had the reputation they have for years . . . But it's clear to me that's going to eventually crumble, because they have a "who cares" attitude about allergies, and in today's restaurant business you can't afford to take that risk.  To top it off  . . . When I went to the rest room to be sick, the waiter scooped the dessert off the table and took it away, despite the fact that Birthday Girl was still enjoying her Happy Anniversary treat!  Edited January 12 2018 -- Moved from 2 Stars to 5.  I posted my review earlier after a great disappointment. I just want readers to know that because I mentioned to the Valet that I had a bad experience as I was leaving the parking lot, I had a call from the office staff at this restaurant. I went back -- no allergy issues, wonderful service, and an incredible meal. I'm left feeling that this was simply a one-off bad situation, with a bad waiter. My service was impeccable on the second go-round, and my partner feels as I do, that it was one of the most memorable meals in our experience.

zakz_e28NOxvd1kEFhORxg.text: I love brunch. I love mimosas. So when I get both, I am happy. We had heard great things about T. Cooks and I had been years ago, so was excited when Travelzoo offered a brunch special. I snagged it and went with my husband and 3 year old son a few weeks ago.   I am not a fan of buffets, but this is one buffet I will definitely be back to - and soon! It was fresh, plenty of selection, and I felt like I actually was able to eat my money's worth. Not only do they have fresh seafood, cheeses, meats, salad, fruit, waffles, eggs and pretty much anything you could want, but the desserts are so good!!   Our son ate for free and I believe I read somewhere that kids under 12 eat free with a paying parent. That is amazing to me!! So many places over-charge for kids these days.   Everyone was so kind. The service could be a bit slow, but I also like that at no point were we rushed. It gave us time to eat, relax, let one plate settle, and get another.   I will be back and hopefully soon!

6ePERGgnz4GXEGemOIs_Zg.text: T. Cook's at the Royal Palms Resort royally ruined our 20th anniversary dinner.  I had read glowing reviews about the chef's off-menu lobster paella for two.  Since my husband is a paella aficionado, we decided this would be a lovely way to celebrate our anniversary.  I contacted T. Cook's over three weeks prior to our anniversary to find out if we would be able to order the lobster paella for dinner.  I received an email from Royal Palms Resort assuring me that T. Cooks's would be happy to accommodate us for our anniversary, acknowledging the availability and price of the paella, and even following up with a confirmation through Open Table.  I responded by affirming that, for the chef's planning purposes, we would be ordering the paella.  When we arrived on the evening of our anniversary, the hostess was very welcoming and verified our reservation.  She seated us at a table for two with a view of the courtyard and Camelback Mountain and then surprised us by sprinkling rose petals on our tabletop, which we considered a thoughtful gesture.  The wait staff were attentive and solicitous.  As we were considering wine selections, the waiter began to discuss entrees and we told him that we had pre-ordered the lobster paella for two.  He looked surprised and said that he would have to check with the chef.  When he returned, he apologized, told us the paella was not available, and asked what we would like to order instead.  We told him that we didn't want to order anything else and that we had made our reservation several weeks earlier specifically for the lobster paella.  (After moving to Scottsdale a little over a year ago, we compiled a list of restaurants to try for our weekly date night and omitted T. Cook's due to its otherwise unremarkable menu when compared to commensurate venues.)  The waiter apologized repeatedly.  Although irritated and disappointed, we were not upset with him because it was not his fault, but we got up and left.  As we passed by the hostess station, the hostess looked alarmed and asked what was wrong.  We explained the situation and she replied that there surely must be a mistake and that she would check with the manager.  When she returned, she seemed quite crestfallen to confirm that indeed there was no paella to be had, apologized profusely, and asked if she could provide us with some type of certificate for another visit.  We refused since we won't be returning and left.  When we picked up our car from the valet, the same scenario ensued--concerned inquiry followed by apologies.  By now, my husband was quite blunt about how T. Cook's had messed up, using far more colorful language.  The only thing that impressed us about T. Cook's was how graciously the staff attempted to handle an unpleasant situation that was not their fault.  Bad form, management.

1J5iccTfbQ2t0l9bCsB5FQ.text: It's been awhile since I've lingered over a 3.5 hour lunch, but what a delightful way to spend an afternoon!  The mimosa flights are not only beautiful to look at, but they are every bit as delicious to drink  The short rib burger is something special. Served with homemade potato chips, it's a mouthwatering experience not to be missed. Rounding out the perfect meal, I ordered the cookie platter AND the gelato trio. The cookies, a lavender shortbread, an orange ricotta (I could have eaten a baker's dozen of these yummy morsels) and a chocolate macaroon, were the perfect complement to the vanilla, chocolate and sea salt caramel gelato.  What a wonderful meal. It really doesn't get any better than this folks. Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cookie plate includes lavender shortbread, orange ricotta and chocolate macaroon. The gelato trio is the perfect complement!
Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mimosa flights of fancy at T. Cooks!

MOrif61BI2ijg-ZV6f_S9w.text: Beautiful and the service was superb. He even excitedly explained the differences in the way the John Dory fish swims! So entertaining ;) This restaurant was at a resort and we dined outside in a courtyard by a fireplace - so romantic! I'll visit again when I'm back in Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. John Dory

d_9OeOMquv7ayy2fX9yHdQ.text: Visited t-cooks last night for a private party.  Started in the lounge with a cocktail til our party arrived. Service in lounge was great even though the server was very busy.  As we moved our way into the party room, it took longer than expected for water, we actually had to ask for it.  I started with the mussels and they were very good, small though.  My husband started with the antipasti which was good.  My husbands grandpa tried the lobster bisque which he said was very good. He also had the fois gras (sp?) liver.  First time trying it and I thought it was very good actually.  As my entree I ordered the lamb which looked amazing on the plate, however lacked any sort of flavor.  It was very bland so I was a bit disappointed.  My husband had the filet and he also said he's had better, also bland.  The wine pairing was great, my husband was left without a drink or water for a long time, even though the server had been in the room a few times.  Overall, (8 people), nobody was raving about the food.  It was a bit of a let down, even the dessert.  3/3 people said it was too rich.  I would come back for the lounge and apps but probably not for the full dining experience.  The grounds are amazing and very pretty but there is better food out there especially for the price range.

73-6jd6yTNrm-oJYiuM1YA.text: T. Cook's and I have a long history but T. doesn't know it.  The first time I met him was over ten years ago when I was just making it in this town.  I had reached my goal for my office and in celebration, I took some of my friends and biggest cheerleaders there to celebrate.  T's food went right to my g-spot and I had an orgasmic reaction right there at the table.   I saved T for special occassions.  The next time I went was again for some celebratory occassion with some friends and once again, T's food went right to my g-spot and I had another orgasmic reaction. The third time, I've been spoiled so I was secretly rubbing my legs together under their pristine table linen in anticipation and didn't care who saw me as I licked every delectable morsel off of my plate and fingers, groaning with pleasure. With gloating praise of T., I got a group of friends together for a private dining experience at the Delano Room (min. $500 spending) for a holiday dinner this past Christmas.  When making the reservation, the lady was a bit snubby which I can accept when I am anticipating another orgasmic experience.   We gather for a evening of fine dining . . . except this time, T. had performance anxiety and failed me.  First the waitress looked like she was overworked and coming into the Delano Room was an inconvinence to her because she has just way too many tables outside that were more important to her.  When my dish came, it had been under the heat lamp for so long that it was completely shriveled that I could not tell what dish I had ordered.  I gave her one look and without a word, she took the dish back and asked me if I would like to order another dish.  Where my g-spot was left high and dry was when we got the bill, the antipasto dish that the waitress had recommended we ordered as a 3-person portion was a whopping $45 per plate.  She had said that "some" additional amount would be added for a larger portion- she neglected to clarify that it would be a whopping 3x's the amount.  And we had 2 plates of those . . . $90 for 2 antipasto plates??   So what was supposed to be my most savory experience with T. was completely anticlimatic and totally blemished my memory of him. I know T's popular so he'll have many suitors- just not this one.

yrRK0o4Jji5x7pemNRvQ4Q.text: Been here for various holidays a few times, it's okay. By okay i mean, go to Four Seasons and eat there instead. I can name about 4 other Arizona restaurants better than this and a little cheaper even with their organic food offerings, sorry :( Plus i agree with the very stuffy old-people atmosphere here, it is always so strange to walk-in here, i feel far too young.

AWOfRvylQF3YdrhUMTu8Zg.text: I love this place.  The food is usually sublime and the service perfect.  Afterwards you can go for a stroll around the grounds of the Royal Palms.

oEjiyPIX9ul6WZW6enXzUg.text: Get your credit card ready. As long as you go in knowing you may be spending a little more than usual for the nice dinner, you'll be okay. I was staying at The Royal Palms and this was the on-site restaurant. Honestly, it's hard, anywhere, to find a hotel with as good a restaurant as this. Dress nicely. Not that they'll turn you away, but the meal is so good, you almost feel obligated. The interior is beautifully decorated, but the outdoor seating is worth taking advantage of if the weather cooperates. The comfortable cushioned chairs are almost like thrones. The service. Props to my waiter, one of the best I've had in a long time. As someone with nut and peanut allergies, I can't remember the last time I felt this comfortable at a meal. Just watching him at work with other guests too, he wanted to make sure you felt taken care of. Now the food. Panzanella salad with butter toasted brioche, mixed greens, fresh mozzarella, heirloom tomatoes, and basil vinaigrette. Fresh, simple, and rejuvenating. Lovely. Duck a L'Orange with duck breast, leg, and thigh, candied orange, asparagus, thyme fondant potatoes, and traditional sauce. This is one of the best ducks I've ever had. It is also the most generous portion of duck I've had: breast, leg, and thigh! As I was savoring each bite, the waiter came and simply said, "Life is good?" "Life is excellent," I replied. The side of butter-poached lobster sealed the deal. Eclairs to satisfy the sweet tooth and a cappuccino to buy time to soak it all in. It's the kind of meal that is so satisfying that all you want to do is go home and go to bed. There's no point in doing anything the rest of the night since there's no way to top it. An added plus is if you stay at The Royal Palms, your room is a short walk away.

jT8CBhm9ZRV8D3ygRcR8TA.text: I am currently staying at the Royal Palms.  The hotel is wonderful.  Beautiful setting.  I love the Spanish villa type architecture, however T Cook is shockingly awful.  I have hoped for wonderful meals at this nice restaurant but everything I've tried has been a tremendous disappointment.  Anyone who thinks they are going to get decadent food at this extremely expensive hotel will be hugely disappointed.  F-.  Outrageously disappointing.  WTF.

QLuilSpqk1JlkAXGE7VOBw.text: I thought we were in for a treat last Friday night as my wife and I, along with a friend, went to T. Cooks for the first time. And it was a beautiful setting no doubt about it. The problem was with the food. All three dishes were lacking in taste, bland, and far below the anticipated standard. For the record they were the sea bass,  the mushroom ravioli, and the scallops. I had the sea bass and while there was no problem with the quality of the fish itself, it was entirely lacking flavor, a tasteless fish with greens underneath that added zero to the dish. My wife had the raviolo which tasted, as she put it, like mushroom paste in beef broth. Our companion described the scallops as "okay". Perhaps our expectations were too high. One dish is, while not acceptable, understandable perhaps as part of the dining experience on occasion. However, all three dishes being below par for a restaurant such as this is a huge disappointment. I don't  know the cause but I do know the solution.

DwI37yvUF5x-L6uXzGcm9A.text: Good place for a very nice dinner.  We went for an anniversary and they really impressed us!  Guys, make sure they know it is your anniversary when you make the reservation.

c9mM5RxxU_b_l1pXSn0CTw.text: Our favorite restaurant in town. Great atmosphere. Chef Lee always gets it right!

X4XP1iU6TGB7amzOKHjvIQ.text: I went to the Royal Palms last night with a group of friends and I loved the atmosphere.  The courtyard was magical and I would have sat out there, but it was a bit cold--i think they have fires out there on cold weekend nights.  We sat inside near the bathroom (which later proved to add entertainment value when a couple was busted hooking up in a men's stall).  Anyway, we had an assortment of wine, beer and martinis.  I tasted my friends' and they were unanimously tasty!  I enjoyed the live music and the people watching was superb--some of Scottsdale's finest surgical augmentation and both male and female cougars!  I will definitely be back and would like to try my friends' recommendation of a 2 day, 1 night getaway without travel with spa, exercise, pool, fine dining, and of course drinks in the courtyard at night!

HzlipYrOKc5E5zvoG-rplQ.text: YUM! Great food, great company, and amazing scenery: This place is cookin'!   I have trouble making food decisions, it's a known fact, so when I turned the menu over and realized I could order half a salad and half a sandwich, I was sold! But then came the hard part, which deliciously sounding salad paired with which 'wich?! Our served told us that the Asian Pear Salad with spiced pecans was a specialty so that was a no brainer. But the difficulty came debating betwen the short rib, smokey turkey and grilled chicken. The braised shortrib on a baguette won-I'm a sucker for good short rib!  The salad was perfect, a nice balance of sweet from the pears and savory from the pecans with a zippy balsamic dressing that brought the whole thing together nicely. The sandwich was good, not the best braised short rib I ever had, but it was a half a sandwich, hard to tell, you know?  Next time I go back to T. Cook's I want to order the real deal, their full braised short rib, and I want to sit at the bar. I've read good things about the experience there pulling up a stool and can't believe I left the place without even taking a peak at the thing! Next time T. Cook's, next time!

vVVc3j2Nl6x-OGDgzgM_lw.text: I can't even remeber what I had for lunch the two times I went 4 years ago. What I do remember was that the property and restaurant was beautiful. I loved the classic relaxed ambiance they created. I must've loved the food because I wouldn't have gone back so quickly, especially to a pricier restaurant on a college budget. I'm sure the ambiance hasn't changed. I need to revisit so I can give an updated review about the food.

MLWYFAQpRcmF3een0tq30w.text: This was a special night out as we would normally not be able to afford T. Cook's, however the three courses for $40 was a great deal for us and as long as we are able to take advantage of this special pricing we will be back.   The ambiance was wonderful.   I had the calamari and shrimp first course, which was delicious. She had the red onion and rosemary soup with havarti cheese, which was also delicious  We both went with the lobster toretllini which was really tasty and had lots of lobster but some the lobster pieces were a little bit chewy. The tortellini was delicious as was the lettuce that came with it.   Desert was outstanding. We shared the chocolate fantasy - very very rich chocolate that when combined with the  vanila gelato and cherries was a great combination. The caramel cheesecake creme brulee was also fantastic. It was much lighter than the chocolate fantasy, which was very dense.   The wine suggestions of our waiter went great with the meal.   Service was oustanding - they were very attentive and friendly - We never felt rushed and didn't have to ask for anything.   As I mentioned above as long as we can take advantage of the 3 courses for $40 we will back again. There is so much more of the menu we want to try.

iPDCaRmKk2jw_oAcmcVouw.text: Visited T. Cook's on the 4th of July for the first time.  Had lived in PHX/Scottsdale for 2 + yrs and return for visits a few times a year.  What a great spot!  By far the best service, atmosphere and food I've had in Phoenix (outside of Lon's at the Hermosa) in quite some time.  Excellent wine selection.  The specials offered something traditional but also creative.  Recommend the pate appetizer and squash soup for a start.  I ate a filet mignon cooked perfectly but I know their paella is also acclaimed.  Decor is intimate, inviting and not stuffy/overdone.

QDHMq4R0i8rNf780ZvpX0g.text: Got together with some friends for sunday brunch..was such a beautiful day decided to be seated outside in the patio area.  The only gripe I have about our visit was our server.  While he was friendly, he was not very prompt in bringing out our drinks and taking our orders.  It was a good thing we were enjoying each other's company or that would of made it worse.  Most of us at the table ordered their eggs benedict which was very good.  Small homemade biscuits with a pesto sauce on it and the hollandaise had a tomato and red pepper flavor.. yum!  It also came with some roasted potatoes.. That dish was only 11.50 and for the place and was inexpensive.

0C3jTaOkDMhu4xalZn99Mg.text: Way too overpriced for the quality of food! I have been there two times and unfortunately I was disspointed both times.   The first time I went for an anniversary. The food was alright, but certainly not 5 star quality. The wine was pretty good, but the waiter was a little snooty about it. Granted we don't know much about wine, but that was precisely why we asked for a recommendation. He acted like we were some loosers for not knowing each wine by name.   The second time I was there was for mother's day, when I was pregrant. I wanted to give them another chance, but it was once again quite dissapointing. The quality of the food is disproportionate to the price and the service was once again pompous and almost discriminatory. I realised we were the only non-white people at that place, but come on, you can't refill our water glasses when you pass us by to refill at the next table? We sat with empty water glasses for almost 15 minutes. That's not service, especially for what you pay!

bKTg42g_Jc61uYoC_tcOQg.text: I've only eaten here once but I was blown away. The food was absolutely delicious....probably one of the best meals that I've ever had in Phoenix. The service was phenomenal. If I remember correctly, it is valet parking only. This is a great place for a romantic dinner.

TKOW1DVzKC1XILPb0PCFRA.text: We have eaten here previously and it was great so when we had out of town company we took them here.  What a disappointment!  My fish was overcooked, guest's beef was tough......Service was mediocre at best.  Looking for a new nice place to go.

1kz3Rbwo2tJk7BE81EN2NA.text: I have been here too many times to count.  My family and I come here for every special occasion... graduation, Christmas, birthdays.  The food is excellent and the service is always superb.   What I love about the Royal Palms and T Cooks is the outdoor seating areas.  In the winter time it is great because they have these nooks with fireplaces and seating so you can have drinks by the fire.

o1TVCijE0fBj6i53AN-SZQ.text: Went here a couple weeks ago for our one year anniversary.  It was amazing!  We had desserts and menus personalized for our anniversary, and the food and service was great.  We both went for the $40 3 course meal.  The grounds at the Royal Palms were amazing!  This was the best meal we have eaten in a long time!    The best dessert ever! My wife had a creme brulee cheesecake and I had a chocolate hazelnut cake.  Both dessert plates had "Happy Anniversary" written on them in chocolate ganache.   At the end of the dinner, they brought us over a souvenir menu that had "Happy Anniversary June 28, 2009" written on the bottom.  Would go back again and again!

zEIPDtFTQQJd0qA72hib8Q.text: Went for restaurant week this evening and was not impressed. The starters of beet salad or green salad were just ok. I have made a better beet salad.  Each of us ordered a different entree. They subbed a sea bass for the pasta dish which was very good. But the chicken was dry and the trout was just good. The deserts were fair and worst of all my hot tea which costs $4.50 was weak and cool. I think I must be spoiled by fine dining in LA and NYC. Will not be back. Service was excellent though. Too bad my food didn't live up to my great waiter.  Also people here do not know how to dress for fine dining. Jeans and sneakers are for Applebee's.

VzpihZ5s53NeJ0HG1xDSsw.text: I didn't appreciate the fact that there was no option to chose the regular menu instead of the Valentine menu only which I think was overpriced and definitely the food was not of the quality matching the price. My date requested a medium well steak and it came over cooked  The restaurant's decor and ambience was very good on the other hand. Overall disappointing experience, wouldn't recommend.

ab9dHaxHew9L6SrqQ7mTtw.text: I had the privilege of eating here for a work dinner on Saturday night. I was thrilled to come here and it did not disappoint! The ambiance is why I gave 5 stars. Its cozy, dim lighting, wood accents, and perfect lounge with a live singer set the mood for the night. The court yard in front of the restaurant was breath taking, even in the moonlight, filled with cobble stones and fresh flowers.   For eats, I had the cheese and meats board to start. Perfectly fresh cheeses!! I had a bite of a friends risotto and it was simple, yet perfectly flavored with a dash of parmesan. For a main, I had the pork chop with gnocchi. The chop was fabulous but the gnocchi was nothing special, considering their were only about 4-5 little tiny ones on the plates. This was obliviously just for show, not for filling up your belly, by any means. The red velvet cake for desert was equal parts moist and decedent. Truly a great desert, and I'm not a fan of deserts.   I fell in love with this place. I will be back one day!

4alzTj9x7HEW4SVjMik--A.text: We hadn't been to T. Cook's in nearly 10 years and were dying to come back and check it out.  We met some out of town friends for dinner on a Sunday night and had a great experience.  The dining room is beautifully appointed and is very welcoming for dinner.  The service is impeccable and our server made great recommendations about our dinner selections.  I enjoyed the beet and goat cheese salad followed by the john dory fish entree.  Our table shared the ginger snap bread pudding with pumpkin ice cream and I could have eaten it all by myself it was so good.  If you are looking for a quality meal in an elegant setting, T. Cook's is the place for you!

r5IA1-zFcYedTyHj4hfSdw.text: I am giving this place few stars mainly due to the service. My husband and I went her for Easter Breakfast. We wanted to beat the croud and we don't eat enough to warrent spending 80 dollars a person for the buffet (crazy expensive). The service was just ok. We were sitting trying to enjoy talking after we finished eating and were really rushed out by the wait staff as they set up the buffet. The food was delicious, but being a paying customer, I don't like to be rushed. It makes me think...how do they treat guests of the hotel? We happen to be locals, but still. Not great customer service.

kXetdMUmlA9-vXRkKuOCBg.text: Tanino, the exceptional server at T Cooks, helped to make my husband's and my wedding anniversary a very memorable event.  His impeccably professional, yet friendly demeanor and vast knowledge of the menu and wine list; assisted us in making wonderful food and wine pairing choices. Thank you Tanino, for all you do every day, to make guest of T. Cooks feel special!  Kuddos also to the sous chef.  In her skillful hands, the art of food and presentation are taken to new levels of beauty and flavor.

H7_OwakN7ZiQBFozOizaKA.text: Came here a few years ago and the food was great. Now we are back and the renovation is awesome and the food is still just as good! I recommend the risotto and the short braised ribs. If you happen to come when it's not too hot, sit outside and enjoy the beautiful landscapes that this resort offers. The outside eating area has misters to keep you cool.

photos.caption: Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. They brought us a surprise dessert for our anniversary! So sweet!
Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TWdyh9iskp2SUer0_12JAA.text: Service A+. Food B-. There was beautiful seating outside next to the herb garden. I had the ribeye topped with Dungeness Crab on a bed of mushrooms and bacon. The steak was ok however; the mushrooms were amazing. My wife had the sea bass which was less than stellar. I gave the overall rating four stars, but the food honestly was about three stars.

photos.caption: Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ribeye topped with Dungeness crab.

cT26Cd-8Z-CutZHkRaw_iQ.text: T Cook's was awesome.  My fiance and I stayed at the Royal Palms with the Royal Romance package over last Christmas. And along with the package, we had 100 dollar credit toward T Cook's. We heard the restaurant was recently renovated and got a different menu and everything, so we were very excited to try.   For appetizer, we got the foie gras which probably was one of the best dishes in our opinion. A tiny piece of foie gras sitting on a sizzling hot stone, combined with orange bread and sauce. It was perfection. We couldn't love it more. Though very pricey, but it's worth it.   Then we got a garden apple salad, which the waiter told us the veggies were grown in T Cook's garden. Pretty cool huh? of course it was very fresh and delicious.   For entrees, my fiance got a steak. he shared a little bit with me and it was soooo tender and buttery, like melting in my mouth. the seasoning was so tasty and just perfect.  I originally wanted the pork tenderloin, but they ran out. So I chose to get the duck dish instead. It was great, but duck itself is often too rich. Me being a 5'1 petite lady was almost full on the foie gras and salad, couldn't finish it.   We didn't get any dessert because we were so full! But overall, we enjoyed the night very much.

F8FSFKgXEmyuaPm-OW4KHQ.text: If you judge T. Cook's against restaurants in general, it probably deserves 5 stars, but if you judge it against what it purports to be, 4 is more accurate.  T. Cook's is a resort-style fine dining establishment.  The attentive valet parking, impressive entranceway, decor, and certainly the prices prove that.  It falls into the class of gourmet fine dining in most respects, but I have long had a problem with the food being unimaginative and the flavor profiles being too simple -- take the arugula salad, for example, which had a strong dried cranberry flavor but nothing else.  That said, T. Cooks has improved over the past few years and certainly has many good points.  The food is very well prepared (the John Dory was excellent), the wait staff is certainly knowledgeable, and the restaurant is attractive and not too noisy.  You won't have a bad experience here until the check arrives.  Of course, you expected the check because you saw their menu (maybe even online before you arrived).  But after finishing the meal, the net effect is "this could have been really great if only ..."  Tip:  before you go here, you might consider buying the Preferred Restaurants of Phoenix card.  Sunday through Thursday (or early on weekends), this gives you two entrees for the price of one, saving you $30-$40, and the card costs less than twice that.  Then you have a year to try about 30 other places.

HTNn9nxyl56pfTLzLgAxtQ.text: Seriously, come here.  I showed up hobbling around with a crutch and the hostess went above and beyond to give me what I needed.  Made a reservation for Saturday brunch. Showed up the day before and asked for champagne to be on the table and to have a card I wrote waiting for my boyfriend (his birthday!).   Arrived the next morning, everything in order as asked, and they were very accommodating with my limp leg.   Ambiance is wonderful. The seats are extremely comfortable, music is at a nice listening volume, timing from all staff was on point (never felt like I was waiting or rushing for anything).   Food is fantastic. Definitely have the cauliflower bisque! A wonderful way to start the brunch. Their Mediterranean Benedict was lovely and the Graham Cracker French Toast was rich and a great desert to the amazing brunch.   You can also walk around the grounds to help digest! The resort is beautiful and great for a stroll.

dH7McvYqMPLOvpz-sgDu7Q.text: Giving them 5/5 for their service. We let them know it was anniversary and they set up a private seating for us in front the the fireplace. The food is probably 4/5 for the food. Good food, not City Hall quality, but worth it.

tiXejIAZZMNZYUscR0DJUw.text: In September my husband and I stayed at the Royal Palms Resort.  We had breakfast and dinner at T Cooks several times; so my review is for multiple meals.  First, we had breakfast on the beautiful patio amongst the trellis and - I started with a bellini; and a lobster omelet.  Loved both of these menu items and I would highly recommend them.  The service was exceptional for this meal. She even offered to make us a reservation for a table for that evening.  We came back for dinner that evening and sat in the dining room. I ordered a glass of rose wine, and didn't like it. I also ordered the scallops which were disappointing and almost inedible. They were small and there were three of them. All three of them had not been rinsed and it was like eating sand. Two nights later we had dinner in the lounge area and the food was good again (that lounge location might have a different name).  This is a beautiful restaurant, and the food options were mixed for me.

v1vK2D66tQ6QuUgn7a0XjA.text: Highly recommend hanging at T Cooks and the hotel (Royal Palms). Killer vibe, great service, the best food - great guac & carne asada tacos. Historical hotel. Awesome place for a romantic get away or wedding. Quaint. Feels like a mission turned hotel and bar. Will definitely stay here next time in Scottsdale. Excellent Service. Cocktails on Point!!!!

nAZwFfQEGqSCNcL11pG3Mg.text: T Cooks is a fantastic place on all levels. We were a bit early, but were seated promptly. Our server, Jeff was extremely helpful and friendly throughout the evening. Scallops were excellent and the John Dory may have been the best fish I have had in awhile. My wife had a steak and it was perfect. The chocolate dessert was too good as well.  We were celebrating our 25th Anniversary and they went above and beyond to make our special day a special dinner as well. Will go back again for our next celebration!!

0wthYOGIlplmKNxP12W0uA.text: Quite possibly the most exquisite gastronomical delight you will ever partake in.   My wife and I went here for our anniversary, and it was our best.    I highly recommend you call ahead and be very clear if you are planning on dining to celebrate a special occassion (particularly one that has to do with romance).  I did, and I'm glad of it.  This place is the cat's meow.    I highly recommend the duck.  The staff actually took it upon themselves to wish us a happy anniversary (and actually wrote it on our dessert plates!), and even took (and gave us) a souvenir picture to remember the evening.    Ambience and service is amazing.

vIyP49ytsW7mLcIOZgVa1A.text: My husband & I have been going to t cooks at royal palms for years! I had my surprise birthday party there 7 years ago . We love it ! After the 2nd renovation we weren't that thrilled with the new "decor" or menu , however, we decided to try it again, this time for lunch . It was my birthday & sat in the back patio & we absolutely loved it ! Charming, romantic & delicious food ! Our waiter Tanino was super friendly without being overpowering. We chatted about our travels to Europe & how this hotel/restaurant made us feel like we were back in Europe.   Everything was perfect .... Including the weather !  Scottsdale has many many restaurants but few have such elegance & grace & beautiful grounds!!    We will return !

fVopKONRnxkDeU5m46_C6A.text: It was my father-in-law's birthday, one of those big milestone birthdays, and he chose to have the family take him to dinner at T Cook's.  T Cook's is recommended a lot in the foodie blogs, often along with Kai and Binkley's.   I haven't had dinner there in probably 10 years or more so was looking forward to trying their current menu.  The wine list is awfully good and as you would expect, the prices reflect it, though I was able to get a very good reasonably priced bottle of Cab which would go well with the lamb I and a few others planned to order...which turned into 2 bottles.  Here's where the experience started going off the rails.  T Cook's has a pretty short entree menu.  They ran out of the lamb, leaving only 8 other entrees to choose from.  There were no specials.    I asked the waitress for a recommendation and she suggested the pappardelle.  What arrived looked nothing like the menu's description.  Where were the morels?  What are these peas doing in here?  And I'm just an ignorant Phoenician, but this thick doughy slab bears no resemblance to any pappardelle I've ever had...or even pasta.  The person sitting to my left, a cultured gentleman with impeccable manners, ordered it too saying it looked to be a dish that would say a lot about the chef.  He politely dubbed it "interesting".  The Birthday Boy deemed the cod watery.  Being a fish, watery could be a virtue, but I don't think he meant it that way.  The other meals were deemed good, but at these prices I would have expected at least one person at the table to be rolling their eyes in their head and moaning.  Dessert was the point where I figured I may as well take out every dollar in my wallet and set them afire.  At least I get some entertainment and warmth from the fire; not disappointment then embarrassment.  The waitress eavesdropped on us to find out just how old our guest of honor was turning that day, a number I deliberately had not shared with the restaurant out of respect for the Birthday Boy who really didn't want to hear it.  When it came time to sing Happy Birthday, there was a complimentary dessert placed in front of him with his age piped in large chocolate numbers on the plate for all to see.  Ugh.  Cringe.  What other words can I insert here to convey the utter embarrassment?  I am a dessert eater. Scratch that - I will eat my dessert and most of everyone else's at the table.  No kidding.  Not tonight.  These desserts were the kind that are little bits of something I can't recognize all over the plate, but none of them satisfy my sweet tooth.  Can't remember the last time I didn't like my dessert.  Kind of made me want to cry.  We and the Birthday Boy forced ourselves to have a good time in spite of everything.  Then we forced ourselves to pay the $700 bill, along with the tip they forced onto it.

rRUd0BV6gkxHQewgVy8KGg.text: Hard to say exactly what you should order, but i've eaten here 5+ times, all three meals.  the service has always been superb.  We typically eat here when we stay at Royal Palms, so having a $50 meal credit softens the blow.  Dinner IS pricey...  Presentation is obviously big here.  Portion sizes are just right.  you won't be stuffed...you will have room for 3 courses.    I generally order something unique here.  not your typical "filet"...go to Donovan's or Dominick's for that.  I think entree's are best.  Apps/soups are #2.  Dessert usually isn't the best part of the meal here.  they almost try too hard with the desserts.  they need to find a couple staples for dessert and make them home runs...i just haven't found that (yet).  Beet salad.  butternut squash soup.  antelope.  lamb.  scallops.  all winners.  enjoy

fqaKWaXqC4-2TAJFTPj74w.text: T. Cooks is an awesome restaurant in Town. The food is amazing and out of this world.  Tanino is the Greatest server I have ever had there.  He is so attentive and gives fantastic service.  T. Cooks gives great portions, you will never get anything bad there, the food and drinks are the TOPS.  The food can't be beat and the price is great.  If you want to be treated like a Queen and/or a King don't miss this place to eat at, you will LOVE it there.

J6E7SaY7mi3e5V6FuLiYBQ.text: Another great hotel restaurant, seems like Phoenix gets this right. They are located in the Royal Palms hotel and restaurant, which is one of the most beautiful places that I've been. I'd recommend checking this place out.  The brunch was my first time trying, for the money you get a lot and it doesn't resemble a college cafeteria like some places do. It's pretty high end stuff with fresh seafood, pasty, cured meats, and some traditional favorites. I highly recommend trying the brunch. The other meals were great, we tried regular breakfast, lunch, and the late night offerings and found everything to be delicious.

mnKwcjt_vfjJucMmUKbmFw.text: Excellent Food - Horrible Service, Badly Managed & Understaffed  Our experience here was bad enough to deduct a star from the Royal Palm hotel. While the food was excellent [Pork Chops / Scallops / broccolini & mushrooms], the service was horrible. We arrived at ~6:30pm on a Sunday - we waited at the empty host station for several minutes. Maybe 5 tables were occupied in the restaurant & a couple of tables outside.  We watched 2 waiters back & forth a couple of times -  they saw us but took no action - not even a 'someone will be with you in a minute'. No other service or management present that we saw. Finally I walked into the path of one of the waiters & asked to be seated - which he did (outside). (Waiter #1356570)  Which began the big 'wait' - wait to place (then get) drinks, a meal order, get butter, ice water, we never got our table cleared between courses - just pushed the empty plates to the side like the Mad Hatter's tea party.   We frequently had to catch the other waiter's attention because ours was so rarely around or so focused on where he was going we couldn't catch his attention - that waiter was polite was visibly annoyed - hopefully at the missing waiter. Finally at the end, my husband went into the restaurant searching for any employee & was stepping into the kitchen when the 'other waiter' stepped out. We never saw a manager or additional wait staff. However, we had the impression that our waiter wasn't overwhelmed due to his number of covers but because he was off doing other stuff. (The number of occupied tables had declined considerably in the 1.5 hours we were there.) Because I left a message on the receipt regarding our bad experience, I explained the reasons for our discontent directly to our waiter. Who nodded & said he was sorry & then was off.

YyK2SRCGNxE4-ZwpzYBe-w.text: Spectacular Sunday brunch. Great a la carte menu in addition to buffet and great service by Kenny. Lovely seating on the outside patio. The shrimp and the crab legs were especially delicious. While the buffet is limited in selection, it is of very high quality. For the price of $ 46, you get the market buffet and a choice of tapas (I chose the seared Foie Gras over French toast) and an entree (I chose the seared Scallops).  The setting of the Royal Palms is very peaceful and luxurious, and the valet, especially Duncan was very warm and welcoming.

7f4TvVFXBJ8cU3Q985i5_w.text: I returned for a full course meal and everything was perfect.  All of the staff were really nice and warm, Paul our server was fantastic and so was our food.  They all helped make my birthday a very blessed night and we will definitely return.

uNVzJC_OjIRbbThGnSx_nQ.text: T. Cook's is a beautiful restaurant hidden inside the Royal Palms Resort. The atmosphere is intimate and romantic - there was even a wedding reception while I was there for dinner! I also appreciated that the staff was friendly and eager to give us the best service possible.   On the savory side of the meal, I had the short rib (a la carte) with the whipped potatoes, and I was very pleased with my choices. The short rib was extremely tender and fell apart easily with a fork (my favorite part of any tasty short rib). I also enjoyed the whipped potatoes and roasted Brussels sprouts.  For dessert, we had a sampling of 3 desserts (I came here with my parents so these weren't all for me, unfortunately). My favorite was the Peach Bread Pudding, which was the seasonal at the time. The bread pudding was moist and super rich in flavor, but the peaches lightened it up nicely. I also enjoyed the Crema Catalina creme brulee, though it was a little toooo heavy on the citrus for me to finish. Finally, the Mocha Torte was beautifully presented, but also a little too decadent and chocolate-heavy for me. Or maybe the Old Fashioned Bread Pudding had already won me over. Either way, I would recommend T. Cook's for a nice dinner out, and take some time to explore the resort grounds while you're there!

dMnb2d2otmTDSFwXqmCaUw.text: We went for a girl's lunch since we were there for the day for the spa. We were the only party i the restaurant on a Saturday. Must not be very busy during the summer. Once we arrived, the hostess notified us that the AC was on the fritz but they were kind enough to bring us over a large standing fan to cool us down.  Some highlights:   -The mussels were shared by our table and it had a great broth and we dipped the table bread in it.  -Nice staff, they indulged us by taking a few pics of our crew -I ordered the tacos and they were good, not fried with a great sauce. I liked how it came on a little metal accordion holder so the tacos stayed upright and not soggy

ZBB8zLBJoHpD3LdQ0RlGxQ.text: The Royal Palms is a gorgeous Hotel. We have dined  numerous times over the years at T Cooks.  Celebrating a friends Birthday lunch there, the food was awful. The chicken was dry and tasteless.our waiter was very gracious and apologetic and there was no charge for desert. I have called 4 times to speak with a manager and have not received a call back. Very disappointed at the lack of service.

4z63mI1L5Sj19lKap3ZDYw.text: I was very disappointed. My husband and I used to go regularly and it was always a special date night. It had been a couple of years since our last visit and we were excited to go again. Unfortunately, it was not how it used to be. The service was exceptionally slow, the waitress explained the menu had recently changed and I'm not sure if that was the reason for the delay. We ordered an appetizer, the scallops, it came quickly and was very good. Dinner took an hour, the waitress avoided us as it became uncomfortable with the long wait. Our food arrived cold and was mediocre at best. The best part of the evening was a wonderful acoustic guitar player. Sadly, I do not think we will be back.

as2wiWR6SYfgR9NbHyfOrA.text: We had a wonderful experience at this restaurant. Sasha was an excellent server. He was so attentive and had perfect recommendations. The atmosphere and ambiance made our experience so memorable. The chef greeted us and was so personable. Kyle, the manager stopped by to check in and was so friendly and professional. We will definitely be back again!

zDF87dWaMg2SgtjZbLTj2Q.text: We came here for our anniversary on a suggestion from our realtor and they did not disappoint.   The service was phenomenal. We were seated quickly and our server, Sasha, had us covered all night. He had a great suggestion for an appetizer and we went with his dinner suggestions as well. We started with the spinach and lentil soup, had the venison strip loin and pork chops for dinner, and then the cheesecake and tartufo for dessert. The food was the best we've eaten in a very, very long time.   For drinks, the Muscow Mule was very strong on the ginger, and very tasty. My girlfriend requested a version of the Love Potion without ginger, and the bartender created a drink she enjoyed thoroughly. We got a Merlot and Pinot Noir with dinner, both of which were alright. Neither were outstanding for the price, but it did not detract from the overall experience.  We highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a great atmosphere, delicious food, and fantastic service. Request Sasha.

rGIoXdwdnHXiQrdNXW5OIw.text: My favorite place for lunch. The courtyard is lovely and so peaceful. Service is impeccable. And the food.... sumptuous!!!  My personal favorite is the mussels.

O-6_ILy-hzORz-2Qo7aYew.text: I came for dinner with my mom & 2 rescue dogs the evening of April 11 (arrived around 530-6pm) The hostess, server and all the staff were so friendly and sincere. The food was great too and the place was peaceful and relaxing where we could hear & enjoy the music from the bar inside. The decor is very nice too but given the history of this hotel they need to get a statue of Our Lady of Guadalupe in there it would look beautiful & be blessed.

wlHKRIMOH-u9wOJPtU0fMA.text: Sadly we dined at T Cooks last night with some friends.  It was overall a disappointing experience.  The bar area was lively and the guitar player was good.  The dining room is so dated.  I understand the "old Arizona" feel that they are going for, but it just feels out of step and really needs a redo.  We were greeted right away by a young man who offered water and other beverages, but we had brought ours from the bar.  We sat for quite a while before I finally asked for bread.  I had not eaten lunch and was starving!  It came quickly with a delicious pesto dipping sauce, but the bread itself seemed like what you get from the bakery at Safeway.  Soft and bland.  Several of us ordered from the Restaurant week menu.  The scallop dish arrived for my friend and it was raw.  She called over a woman who turned out to be the manager.  She handled it well whisking away the plate and returning to say a new one was being retired.  When the plate returned, the scallop which had been sliced in half by my friend returned cooked through, but clearly the same one that had gone back.  The entrees were good, no complaints there.  But the service during dinner was abismal.  One of us had to keep refilling our water goblets from a pitcher that was near by.  The woman trying to open our wine clearly did not understand how to do it, so we had to open our own wine.  We also had to refill our own glasses throughout the meal.  Several times when we wanted something we looked up to find not a single server on the floor of the dining area.  Dessert came for those of us who had ordered the Prix fixe menu, but those of us who did not were not even asked if we wanted a dessert!  I asked for a menu and ordered the deconstructed strawberry shortcake.  The strawberries were good, the rest of it inedible.  The other deserts were also left relatively untouched.  They were all awful.  This restaurant used to be our go to for special occasions many years ago, but now it just doesnt work.

W7fIpaLcr_I9nG_c0mOPOw.text: This place has Four Diamonds for very good reason...it's amazing. The garden entry and rustic interior is one of the best restaurant atmospheres I've ever seen. They have an excellent bar area with a fireplace. The inside is absolutely beautiful, with each table having a slightly different theme. The waiter was excellent. He had a great personality and was very patient with all of my questions. The pacing was perfect.  Their focaccia bread with pesto was amazing. Freshly baked, great flavor, and wonderful olive oil.   The octopus appetizer was incredible. It was perfectly cooked, which is one of the hardest culinary feats. Most places overlook it, but they prepared it so it cut like butter. Served with a great olive tapenade.  The black truffle soup was probably the best soup I've had this year. The strong truffle flavor was complimented by the cream base.  And for the entree, the best lamb dish of my life. Perfect medium rare, served with homemade tatziki sauce, feta, and cucumbers. It was accompanied with falafel.  Overall, one of the best restaurants in Phoenix, and very romantic.

Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Black truffle soup

v1UExP6xkX3254abJg3lZA.text: We went with friends to T Cook's last Friday night during AZ Restaurant Week.  We had a lovely dinner in the main dining room.  Our waiter (French guy) was very nice, patient and accommodating.  We wanted to relax and visit and once we let him know that the evening was perfect. The food was delicious.  Love this place and hope to go back when weather cools to enjoy beautiful outside spaces.  Hostess people were very nice too.

C9HVYDuAP-dwf7FTdRlc6Q.text: Very disappointed.  We went to T Cook's for Christmas Day brunch.  At no time during the reservation process was I alerted to the fact that this was a $95 per person menu.  As a matter of fact, the online reservation reflected a Sunday brunch menu for $45.  Had the food been superb and the service excellent, I might have gotten over it.  But the food was only so-so and the service kind of slow.  Such a beautiful setting!  Too bad.

QOa60lKaXV2E5oAXH-e0ow.text: Waiter was average. Food was actually really good. Overall for the price I gave them a 3.

doCmFXFcohIZtc9wTlSe8A.text: Wow wow wow the food was delicious.... started with the cheese platter each cheese was so tasty my favorite was the humboldt fog from cypress grove ....it was so smooth melted in your mouth like butter ....I got the ribeye with mushrooms on the side   Mmmm the mushrooms were perfectly sauteed with herbs and butter ..... the steak had a great crust on it hubby had the bronzino fish he loved it ....dessert was butter croissant bread pudding warm and lovely not to sweet perfect meal ....
