PJke1rrkznCTabYIpWir3g.text: One of the best dining experience I've had in Scottsdale/Phoenix. This place is tucked inside of the Royal Palms resort. Great selection, excellent service and a classy ambiance.  Went with the salmon, mash and brussel sprouts for my meal. Washed it down with a wine selection from the waiter. No complaints from start to finish and I would certainly go back.

phX351D4ikW16aoWfbaWEA.text: This review is for brunch...4 1/2 stars for sure!  We were among a small group seated outside on a beautiful Sunday morning.  Brunch is a set $46 per person.   You're paying for quality and quantity.    You are presented with a menu from which to pick an appetizer and an entree.  In addition, there's a small buffet that includes excellent shrimp cocktail, crab claws (my fave!), caesar salad, marvelous cheeses, pastries (I loved the blueberry), fresh fruit including an assortment of berries and pineapple, and other items.  And the price also includes two mimosas and coffee or tea.    The most intriguing part of the menu imho are the tapas:  Beef Tartare, Mushroom Crepe, Foie Gras w/French Toast, Hummus.  All of which our table got. There was also a Tomato Bruschetta option.  I must admit I was disappointed in the Tartare.  It really needed some acid or something to brighten it up.  The Hummus was delicious but way too much for one person.  Foie Gras was very rich.  I'm not sure I'd call the bread that was with it French Toast, but that and the berries were a nice balance to the liver. Husband really liked his mushroom crepe.  As for the entrees, we had our choice of Grilled Smoked Ham Steak with Eggs, Ricotta Blueberry Pancakes,  Spanish Chorizo Benedict,  Paella, Fried Chicken, Grilled Flat Iron Steak with Chimichurri and Fries, Eggs & Pupusa, Scallops, or Sea Bass.  I headed straight for the Scallops while Husband did the Steak.  Both of our entrees were really good.  Loved my perfectly seared scallops with cannellini bean puree, carrot and bacon.  Mmmm!  Husband was happy with his steak and fries as well, but it has to be the first time I've ever seen him waste a lot.  It was just too much.  If you make it to dessert (and I suggest you do), they are thankfully small.  We shared a teeny lemon meringue tart, and a key lime dessert.  There were also chocolate and raspberry desserts.    Service was entertaining and enthusiastic, which I really like.   Husband was kept topped up with coffee, but I never got a re-fill on my excellent iced tea.    If you live in the area and can take home some of what you can't eat (if they allow it), it would sure make me feel better, because I hate to waste food!  With the buffet part, we can control what we choose and only pick what we can eat, but when presented with the appetizer and entree in large portions, it can lead to too much waste, imho.  Otherwise, a lovely and delicious experience in a beautiful historic setting.    Note:  parking is free and easy, but you can valet it if you so choose.

4zvpOKFOakRqbNev7D4iYg.text: Came here tonight for date night with the hubby. It was so delicious !!! We were greeted by friendly smiling faces and sat outdoors to enjoy the beautiful weather. We started out with the charcuterie board it was the perfect amount of cheese to meat ratio , They also bring you a complimentary bread with pesto that is very good. We ordered the Beef Short rib with Farro & the Wagu Sirloin with a lobsters risotto and asparagus. That for me was the star of the two dishes the meat was tender and cooked to perfection. Lastly we ended the night with the 7 layer Bananas cake with pecan ice cream. My only complaint would be for the size of cake they serve you it need at least 2-3 scoops of that delicious ice cream very heavy and rich we couldn't even finish it but was something I will be making a special trip for again in itself. This place is pricey but the food was very good nothing lacked in flavor or portion size. I hear they have a great brunch so will be doing that very soon with some girlfriends. The grounds are beautiful and I can't wait to return soon.

tL0WKuN9yyo-A8fipEvxaA.text: Since my last review the menu and chef has changed.  T Cooks is an upscale Mediterranean Restaurant located at the Royal Palms in Phoenix. This once was a winter vacation home of a wealthy New York Person and now it's a beautiful Spanish Style Resort and Spa with T Cooks Restaurant.  The dining room is very dramatic with high ceilings and very mature palm trees growing threw the dining room.  They start everyone off with tasty rosemary focaccia and fresh pesto.  It was restaurant week fall 2018 3 courses for $44.00 so we ordered off that menu.  I started with Moroccan Spiced Carrot Soup. It had delicious warm flavors, a rich mouth feel and pops of sweet raisin in it but was painfully salt forward to me. I did tell my server and he insisted on having the kitchen fix the soup. He took it back and they watered it down and when he brought it back it indeed was less salty. (*****this is highly unusual)   My husband had the Butternut Squash Agnolotti. They were very similar to ravioli with nice well made thin pasta skins. They were generously stuffed with sweet seasoned butternut squash. They were described to be in a sage brown butter sauce but if you take the time to view my photo it's more like they were in a parsley melted butter sauce.....This dish ran on the sweet side.  For me and my husband our favorite bite of the evening was the Pan Seared Glacier Sea Bass. The fish was very fresh and was cooked to perfection. The beet/bean puree and almonds were tasty. The Tomatoes were very salt forward.  The Petite Filet my husband had did have nice grill marks and was also prepared to his request (M/R) but lacked salt and pepper. White Cheddar  Grits with Bacon wrapped haricots verts were excellent.  Of the two desserts one we loved and one we didn't.  The Butter Croissant Bread Pudding was heavy and very dense. I didn't care for the flavors either.  The Crema Catalana had a nice not burnt tasting thin hard shell and contained cream that was smooth and DELICIOUS with a sort of bitter kind of orange taste.   Stand outs were- Focaccia and Pesto Glacier Sea Bass Cheddar Grits Crema Catalana Attentive Service Lovely Atmosphere  Valet parking only

narq9eyEk_rTD7A2l8eOYg.text: This is always a fabulous dining experience..from the minute you drive up the beautiful drive looking at the mountains and lovely landscaping, surrounded by the towering palms..you just know it is going to be a great experience.  It never disappoints.  The food is 5 star for sure, the service 4.5 and the ambiance of the whole place is just a 10 plus.  Have a drink in the beautiful bar and then either eat in the beautifully appointed dining room, or if weather allows, outside on the patio or surrounding tables outside.  Walk around the grounds and see this lovely oasis.  Don't miss this gem!

dS1MPTUBqkdA3hgBStXH1A.text: We went to T Cook's for our anniversary tonight. The atmosphere was wonderful and the meal was great. The reason I gave the three stars is I ordered the snake river strip loin medium rare. When I cut into the steak it was raw. I called the server over to send it back. When it came back to me it was brought back by a food runner with no apology from the server or a manager. An apology with the question "is it prepared to your liking" goes a long way. Also I found it interesting the quarter of the steak I cut off to see how it was cooked was missing when it returned to me.

e5GRiNP8D0z_S-IrW9Eksg.text: Great atmosphere inside this beautiful restaurant. Super fun patio in both front and back. Our service was exceptional. Food was brand new (the menu that is) and was really innovative. Highly recommend the seafood appetizer served on hot stone.

7Fo2aJUmtcu8PABbg5UfuQ.text: We came here for an early NYE date night since my husband was scheduled to work on NYE and we had a great meal. We were able to sit on the patio where they had loads of heaters and it was actually the perfect temperature, even in December! There was a table facing the fireplace that looked so romantic and cozy. When we asked to sit there, they told us that it was reserved but then no one came the entire time that we were there! :( So we were a little bummed that we had to sit in the corner of the patio when that was open, but hey, can't win them all I suppose!  For food, we started with their scallop appetizer and it was SO TASTY! My only complaint was that you get 2 scallops for $16. Whew, a little pricy but the flavors were extraordinary. I think even if they had 3, that would have been a good amount. 2 just seemed a little weird on the plate. They also brought DELICIOUS bread and pesto. You could tell the pesto was made fresh there on site. We also ordered a bottle of  Cabernet and it was the perfect compliment to our meal.   Next, my husband and I split the heirloom beet salad and it was one of the best beet salads that i've ever had. The feta dressing was phenomenal! The arugula was nice and peppery - just the way I like it.  For my entree, I ordered their Flat Iron Steak and it was SO tender! It seriously rivaled a filet and was a great portion size. It is served with their signature steak sauce that I absolutely loved as well. For sides, we split the fries with truffle aioli and Haricot Vert Nicoise (green beans served cold with olives, feta, and a lemony/vinaigrette dressing). THEY WERE AMAZING!   For dessert we split their gelato (served on an ice block!) and cookies and the lavender gelato was dreamyyyyy! The cookies didn't knock my socks off but the gelato was well worth it.   All in all, the culinary talent here is great! For the price range, I have had better meals at other Valley establishments but we definitely didn't leave hungry and our tastebuds were happy! :)

6yc1GGeFyJ23lz8dYCCQvQ.text: I would say a 4.5 would be a fair statement to make. The Royal Palms is a beautiful resort with a rich history; However! Certain things need to be slightly updated (the spa and the villas) stay tuned for my resort review. The ambiance in T Cook's probably has received the most TLC as it is a renowned restaurant but we have a tiny bit more to do with the interior (not a full on facelift but maybe a small tuck) I understand the history of the resort so I am not suggesting an industrial theme like wall to wall steel and cement floors but little things can make a difference. BRUNCH!  Started with the Maine diver scallops, so fresh with bacon bits and spinach. It came with a carrot ginger puree, I am not a fan of carrots but the hint of ginger complimented it nicely. We ordered the fresh berries and the vanilla yogurt, the berries were so fresh and visually stimulating and the yogurt was the best I've ever had (he agreed as well) Huevos Rancheros delicious! Probably the freshest Avocado I have ever had, the corn tortilla perfectly crispy. ONLY CON: My over easy egg was perfect when I cut into it, oozing just as it should, my friend said his egg while delicious was slightly over cooked. The staff was fantastic they don't hover but you always know they are nearby. The coffee is strong and firm just how we like it!

5s0-cUkhpt5IjzMHRt0Ghg.text: Stellar!! This is a well earned five star review. Why? Read on....  Atmosphere: this place is really beautiful inside. The resort itself is also beautiful. But, this restaurant does not try to make it self classy by leaning on the beauty of the resort and natural surroundings. The restaurant itself is warm, classy but not stuffy at all, with high ceilings, beautiful fixtures and lighting, warm woods, spacious, soft, somehow modern yet with classic warmth and style, tables are beautifully set with quality components and everything you need is at your fingertips, it's extremely comfortable. Heavy wood chairs with soft padded seating, super comfortable to stay for hours and relax.  Service: The server and  assistants ensure you have everything you need here. They are knowledgeable and prompt without hovering. Such a great feeling to experience wait staff that seems genuinely interested in your comfort and experience. Everyone working here was clearly happy to assist, even if they weren't "assigned" to your table. Extremely service oriented. Excellent!  Food: outstanding! The four of us all thoroughly enjoyed our appetizers, the delicious bread they serve while you wait for your entrees, and our entrees themselves, as well as the adult beverages. Every detail of every morsel was prepared with high-quality ingredients and a chefs touch. All foods were well balanced, flavorful and seasoned perfectly. Served at just the right temperature, without long waits and with solid, high quality,, comfortable, flatware, silverware, and glass. Appetizers, meals and even the drinks are plentiful and delicious. The entire "food experience" was excellent.  Value: in my opinion, your truly eating at a five-star restaurant, with outstanding, chef prepared meals, served by staff who are mature, knowledgeable, friendly and attentive, in an environment that is warm and comfortable and inviting. It's hard to beat for the appropriate prices, which are reasonable for the excellent experience, quality and quantity.  There was one thing I really didn't like and it started off our experience with an uncomfortable bump, it was the valet and parking situation. I fault the resort for this more so than the restaurant. I was driving a high horse power convertible sports car that night and prefer not to let valets drive it (scary flashbacks of Ferris Bueller's Day Off), so I asked to self park. Once I did, the valets fake friendly, interested demeanor immediately changed to being dismissive, uncaring, "Oh, I'm not going to make a few bucks off of you and I can't drive your nice car? Then I could care less!!" I found myself cramming my nice car into a small spot in a very, very small, dark parking lot with no more than 15 or 20 spots. In hindsight, I should have parked between the palm trees around the traffic circle in front of the restaurant like I noticed others had done when we left. This was not a good start to our experience at the location. Again, I'm choosing not to fault the restaurant for the parking situation at the resort.  I highly recommend T Cooks for all reasons stated above. Honestly, I can't wait to go back, it's one of my new favorite places. My only regret is that I didn't find this place is much, much sooner.

yqdwkmSPJhi2cCNXec7U4g.text: Had such an outstanding meal here last night.  Our server Candy was simply outstanding.  We were taking our time and she was great in giving us space while ensuring we had what we needed.  Plus she offered great suggestions.  I highly recommend the short rib ravioli, but T. Cook's is one of those places where everything is excellent.  Happy dining!

photos.caption: Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

N4exjqeIwFGb2FDIWCn6zg.text: We've been dining at T.Cooks on and off for years. We haven't been back since the reopening. Driving up to the property at night is delightful. Once inside, we were quickly seated. Adam, our waiter, was prompt and courteous and explained the pre-fixe menu thoroughly.  Our meal was splendid: osso bucco lamb for my wife and the venison loin for me. Adam was perfectly attentive. We didn't expect to spend our Christmas Eve dining alone together (without family), but the night was just perfect, with live music, vibrant ambiance and a walk around the grounds to end the night. Well done, T.Cooks.

n_Tw0iSpKF5K7wKqgNjpbA.text: I live in the Phoenix area but wanted to go somewhere special for breakfast for my birthday. So glad we decided to come here. It feels like you are transported into another country. Ambience is amazing, food was fantastic and wait staff was on point. Great kickoff to my birthday. Perfect place to come if you have guests in town!

qolTHQHYNaKxY2FKkevyZQ.text: Don't be afraid to try the green eggs and ham. It is out of this world.  T. Cooks is beautiful, with superb service and a wonderful menu. The desserts are design masterpieces.  The table bread is fresh and made every day.  There is certain to be something on the menu you will fall in love with.  Whether you eat in the court yard, inside or on the patio, this place is perfect by yourself, with your sweat heart or a group.  The grounds at the Royal Palms are beautiful and you will feel like you are in Paradise.

photos.caption: Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great outdoor seating for groups.
Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cosy rooms.
Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Comfortable beds with quality linens.

20PgDb6tjed-49AnaUxA-Q.text: A long awaited return to one of our old favorites, but disappointing to the food - unexpected! mussels & clams - gritty,bread accompanying - cold; 2 racks of lamb, underdone, tough and chewy; seabags and lobster risotto were good; the 2 btus wine were very good - and pricey of course. considering the cost, i would say the meal was pretty unacceptable.. a tues so maybe not the 'A' team in place in the kitchen.

ilR5lyjz6cwahP061XrDVQ.text: Truely one of the best places to eat and celebrate a special occasion

photos.caption: Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chocolate Decadence
Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Halibut
Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ribeye

gnvYLsCGFlMjR9a_E61NLQ.text: Went to a birthday dinner and was so impressed! Had the corn bisque as an appetizer, then had the wild antelope for the main course. For dessert, I had the white tea pana cotta which was light and refreshing.

wdSgV1eExKmRkluHEmPuXA.text: We had lunch at T Cooks twice this weekend.  I wanted to visit the second time simply to confirm that it was as good as the first time.  Beautiful ambience, excellent food and service, this place has it all. I had the winter pear salad and the crispy salmon.  We also ordered the lobster bisque and the chicken salad sandwich.  We each ordered a flight of wines, which is a bargain at $25 and highly recommended.  We shared the dessert tasting (your choice of three small desserts for $8).  They also have a cozy little chef's table for two. T Cook's was the highlight of our weekend in Phoenix!

C-kKfm4gZ1xO3EYyAhO-4w.text: Because breakfast was so good last time we were there, we decided to try out the new lunch menu. It did not disappoint! Our server Jackie, again, helped guide us through the menu. We had the Spanish Octopus and the Chicken Carbonara. The octopus was amazing! So much flavor and textures all in one plate. We are so glad Jackie was there to wait on us again! Looking forward to dinner next!

52yjyQydj9w4IBjRL16-8A.text: Inside the Royal Palms Resort is an elegant restaurant and lounge. We had drinks from the lounge in the courtyard with a nice fountain splashing in the background. Try the Sonoran Sage for an interesting take on a gin martini. After drinks we went inside to the main dining room with a wood fired grill. They have both an ala carte and tasting menu. Our party of four had a variety of interesting dishes which included seared foie gras, frogs legs, octopus, scallops, lamb osso buco, flat iron steak with exotic mushrooms and a braised short rib. We washed it down with a 2000 Dunn Howell Mountain cabernet. The service and wine service were outstanding and the food was delicious. I can't comment on the value as it was comped via a friend's trade agreement with the hotel. I would definitely eat hear again even if it were on my own dime. I highly recommend the lamb osso buco with it's North African flavor profile, simply outstanding. We had breakfast here the next morning and the food was well prepared and delicious. I had the Huevos Rancheros with house made spicy chorizo. The other in our part said their breakfast dishes were also very good and included the Mediterranean style eggs Benedict and corned beef hash. Great service and an endless cup of coffee rounded out a great experience at the resort.

z0GsiNzdvqvxT8Gh_ZSHEg.text: Great night out at T. Cooks in the Royal Palms Resort! Bridget, our server was amazing! Great attitude, very attentive, never needed for anything! Thanks T's!

photos.caption: Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Side room at T&#39;s

f429S1co6t3JHFVgJBvY9A.text: Mmmmmm, Mmmmm, Mmmmm...Never Fails...  This place is UNBELIEVABLE for breakfast and Lunch (i have heard great things about dinner as well although i have yet to enjoy it).   i have only been for lunch twice, but both times were fantastic.  The first time i had the Burger (wonderful) and the second time i believe it was the Halibut (could have been Seabass) and was equally as delicious (i have posted a photo).  What i really want to talk about is their Breakfast though...OMG-favorite spot in town.  I am a huge eggs benny fan and they have this Mediterranean version that is out of this world.  It's on Focaccia bread with prosciutto and this red bell pepper hollandaise sauce...SO GOOD (i have also included a photo of this dish).  Also, try their green eggs and ham.  :)  Hope you all enjoy this place as much as i do!!  Bon Appetit!

photos.caption: Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs Benny
Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7m9AO6XpcIyatjWLVHFLJA.text: The food is a little above average, but the price is way way above average, it is not with the high prices. Had desert and a cup of coffee...$18!!!!  The service is awesome, but I can't give it 3 or 4 stars because the prices are so high. I had the strawberry rhubarb torte.

pAs4mI5W8tjKgz38Sjk65A.text: Impeccable, memorable,  5 star service  was our experience from every employee.  Staff  were warm and attentive;  you imagine your at a friend's Estate and all the staff have been instructed to treat you royally, and we were.  Food at T. Cook's  honestly was for the price and everything considered  a 3.5 which ends at  a 4 star average because of the service.   We did the $99 summer 3 course meal:  I ordered a Cherry blossom cocktail  $12. I was imagining this to come out in some hip glassware with  some kind of cool cherry blossom fruit/flower flair, but no just a normal glass, kind of like you would get any average place.  Wow the description of the cocktail had me thinking up something divine. Ok back on point,,, Bread:  Served Warm, toasty (it better be, this is one of  my pet-peeves, it must always be W/T. It was.  Served with delicious, outstanding pesto.   I ordered the crab cake for my 1st course and it was good;but it is contending with Crab cakes I've had in Maui at Mama's Fish house. Beach Vs Desert crabcake? It isn't a fair match but a definite honorable mention for desert contender. Regardless I've still got my Cheshire cat happy face on.  2nd course : Neiman Ranch Pork CHop with balsamic glaze.   Excellent cut of meat ,tasted like steak, but for me the glaze was a little salty.  This was accompanied by baby carrots & Potatoes Anna, my carrots were kind of hard I really had to pin them down to get a bite prepared.  I was wishing I had Lorraine not Anna on the potato front; mine were kind of  bland.   Dessert : Chocolate truffle ganache cake,HOME RUN!! OUTSTANDING!!!!!  Total Bill w tip included $175.  Summary, Considering the overall value and we went here on a gift certificate I might  feel compelled to remove a  star if on our own dime/ dollar. but again customer service was outstanding so I think overall you pay for that and it did make for a special occasion, so verdict remains!   I would love to come back for dessert anytime ] .  The grounds are pristine!! It is a gem of a resort.

z2RJzZkiqMTuercgUKgA3w.text: I dream of the day I have enough riches that I can hang out in places like Royal Palms regularly. I mean the night I showed up, well it was night, but it was also pouring down rain, and even through all of that Royal Palms was pretty enough to make me stop and look around before rushing in out of the weather. I headed into the bar to meet up with a few folks and the interior is just a beautiful space - warm and welcoming, and very classy. Bring people here that you want to impress.  I, of course, had to order a glass of champagne and the lovely server brought it right to me. Perhaps she sensed I had been delayed at the airport that day before arriving to Phoenix for 7 hours? Or more likely they are just very good at what they do here. We immediately ordered since it was so late and I started with a pear, pecan, and blue cheese salad. For my main course I choose a seared Irish salmon that was served with leeks, tomato gratin, and a pea puree. It was all fantastic, but the tomato gratin made me want to invite the chef to move to LA with me. I mean no way could I afford that now, but a girl can dream!  We finished by sharing a couple of desserts and the one I chose was the Florale. It was made with lychee mousse and was quite light and just a bit tart. All in all a delicious ending to a delicious meal.

wv2GWG0vSK5P3zluUj0WlQ.text: It was that time of year again, and I have to say that I'm still somewhat unimpressed. This place has such great potential, but its face just seems to keep writing a check that your stomach can't check.   The devil is in the details, and for some reason, the details all fall short here. Its not that the food is bad...its quite good, actually. But for the price you pay, it should be perfect, not "quite good". Specifically, every bit of cooked meat that was offered was over-cooked and dry. Homemade chicken sausage looked delicious, but was nearly flavorless and seriously, I think I could get a more moist piece of chicken cooking it in the microwave. The fresh grill was lamb, which I love. Again, very very dry. That just sucks.  And again, as with my last review from a year ago, if I'm spending the extra money on an entree, don't then give me an item on my plate that is readily available on the buffet that is included in the price. That makes me feel ripped off, and that your chefs are just plain lazy.  So, for not fixing anything in the last year, I'm demoting this place by a star. I did, however like the new buffet and menu items. And, as always, the staff was friendly and attentive, professional and unobtrusive. Keep that up, but fix the stupid shit please! See you in a year.

8aC4TF-Kqp8zXAz95GB50w.text: Robert was more than helpful. Helped us choose a great bottle of wine and was very friendly. Recommend the papa brava. Soooo good!!

XzHrXml-HVx8wEy8_AvE0A.text: You've got be kidding me. Possibly the worst upscale dining experience I've ever had. I don't mind paying a lot for food when it's good, but this just felt like complete robbery. So many things wrong from start to finish.   My brother asked for his ribeye black and blue (very rare) and it came out medium.  For a $50 steak you gotta get it right. On top of that, four out of our five entrees sat outside getting cold (we were eating outside in January) while waiting several minutes for the fifth to arrive. When it finally did come, it was excruciating to watch the backserver study the ticket at length before placing each dish at the table.  When the food is that much at risk of getting cold, you should have more than one person serving.   Another thing I cannot forgive is the lobster. From the description and the $44 price, you assume it is a whole lobster. In fact it is a claw and half a tail, the same thing they have as a side dish for $20. The preparation and side dishes were very minimalist, so I'm not sure what that extra twenty four bucks is for. Like I said I expect a certain markup for good food, but you don't have to gouge people quite so egregiously.   I started with the lobster bisque, a "house specialty." Not really remarkable, basically what you expect. For entree I had the scallops with chorizo and basquaise sauce. I like each of those things individually, but together they were just fighting in my mouth. Desserts were nothing worth writing about.  Food and service are below average for this price level, period. The only thing you can say is that the hotel surroundings are attractive. With so many good restaurants in the area, there's No Excuse for going here. Go to Tarbell's down the street and enjoy a superior experience.

wcPJbnWZ7wNa0ELeizzJJw.text: We haven't been to T-Cooks for a while so we thought we'd go with friends Saturday night.  What a mistake. The service was horrible. Our waiter Marc kept rudely interrupting conversations to ask again and again if we had any questions.  It was as if he were trying to rush us so he could have table turn over. When we ordered a bottle of Cabernet off the regular wine list (not the reserve list) he told us he was out of Cabernet? When I told him I couldn't believe that and wanted to speak with a manager he came back with the wine? Really? He kept interrupting us wanting to take the order again and again. He told us salads were very large and suggested we split them.  Well, they are not large and just perfect for one. Entrees were just okay.  The duck was tough and cooked very rare (I ordered it medium) served with a side of something very bland. My wife had a fish dish that was very good.  All in all I would not go back due to horrible service and average food, Too bad because the Royal Palms is a beautiful property.

LVS6XiMRb9JVvlyPpNGjAg.text: Started our stay at the Royal Palms with a great dinner at T.Cooks. Love the heirloom carrots.  Breakfast this am with Jackie as our server was lovely. She was friendly and very attentive. Looking forward to seeing her for breakfast all week

Yvgir2euCSes3lstOmccug.text: Two nights ago my brothers and I took our mom here to celebrate Mother's Day. We were aware of the high reputation of the restaurant so we knew this was a great way to treat our mother. The restaurant is very lovely, and for the staff alone I would go there again as they were really courteous. However, our service was really disappointing. We ordered our food at 7:30 but didn't even get the bread until almost 9, and that was after asking our waiter twice when we could expect our food. Finally the bread came out, and after another ten minutes our main course came out.  The only problem was that they completely left my order off the ticket. It was another 10-15 minutes before my meal arrived, making my wait time well over an hour.  However, all issues aside, the Bass I had was incredible and well worth the price of $30. On the plus side, they were embarrassed by their poor service, so they gave us free dessert and took 25% off our whole tab.

W-DySNFePs8P4SCynfd6GQ.text: PLENTY of reasons not to give five stars.  For the, ahem,  "upscale" pricing, the quality of the food should be absolutely superb. It simply is not.   While the atmosphere is lovely and the service was very good, the food was a huge disappointment. I had the flaxseed vegetable napoleon for the first course. It was completely underwhelming and the flaxseed patties were impossible to cut through. Additionally, the taste was not very good.  For my main course I had the New York strip steak. It was good. The brussels sprouts were great, but the Yorkshire pudding was not thrilling--perhaps that is a matter of personal taste. The pesto that is served with the bread was awesome--but messing up pesto is pretty hard to do.   The side of whipped potatoes were WAY over-salted, and the mac and cheese was entirely underwhelming. I felt like we paid an outrageous price simply because it said "truffle" on the menu. In reality, the flavor was salty, decidedly average, and it was quite dry. Very disappointing.  For dessert we shared the eclaires and the gingerbread/apple upside down cake. The eclaires were absolutely nothing special. I have had better, many times in my life. It was very saddening because we had heard such raving comments about the pastry chef, and in fact the quality of the pastry--both in taste and texture--was pretty sub-par for a dessert that costs like 20 bucks. The ginger cake was good, but unmemorable.   The service and the steak were the best parts about the experience. The steak was very good, and the service was also good but I have had better and more helpful in other places.   For a meal that essentially cost $100 per person, the taste was AVERAGE, and the overall quality of the food was horribly disappointing. Every single person in our party agreed. It is very easy to be taken with the fancy atmosphere and get carried away thinking the food is a lot better than it is because it looks pretty, it costs a lot, and the Royal Palms is beautiful. Don't let the external appearances fool you. Taste the food for what it is. Disappointing for the price.  EDIT: It should be mentioned, however, that the lobster bisque was absolutely delicious, far better than anything else I ate the whole night. Very, very good.

MNZwVP2OVZd_SJeJbgdHWg.text: T.Cooks is one of our favorite restaurants in Phoenix. The food is always excellent and the service is top notch. The warm and inviting atmosphere of the hotel carries through to T. Cooks and we always look forward to a night out here. There is so much character to the Royal Palms, so take time to walk the grounds before or after your dinner.

EAshjBuZ29bYwlZkR5gstw.text: I really wanted to love this place. It came highly recommended by Yelpers and a personal friend who used to live nearby, so we were excited to check it out. Set in the Royal Palms, you walk through a lovely garden to get to the restaurant. It was raining the day we went, so we coudln't sit outside, but I'm sure it's beautiful.  We started with a couple glasses of wine, and the charcuterie plate. My bf loves cured meats, and we often order a similar appetizer at one of our favorite restaurants close to home. So we were terribly disappointed to be served a plate with only a couple slices of maybe 4 different meats, a small slice of pate, sliced pickles, a bit of mustard. That's it? For $13? The bread was served with some delicious pesto, but quite a bit of it, considering there were only 2 of us.  For entrees, bf ordered the seared scallops, and I had the short rib. His tasted fine to me, but I only had 1 bite. Halfway through the meal, he thought it smelled like BO, and couldn't finish it. Mine was ok, really nothing to write home about. Maybe we didn't order the right things, but we just were not impressed.  Service was great all the way through, thus the 3 stars. For me, the food wasn't bad, but nothing spectacular, as it should have been for the prices. Not sure what I was missing, but I just couldn't say this was a great experience.

jf15YAvkIG8cW70qqLyvgg.text: I have been to T. Cook's several times over the past few years- both lunch and dinner.  I think it is a beautiful and romantic dining experience.  The food has been well prepared and presented over all of my visits although I would stop short of calling it phenomenal.  I have mixed feelings on the service as I feel that some of the staff come across as a bit superior or condescending which I find  offensive.  Others have been marvelous.  My next goal is to stay at the resort...and have at least one dinner at T. Cook's.

0h1QqOEBvpFmikciDfrhqA.text: Another great dinner in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area.  We tried out T. Cooks for our Saturday dinner date.  Located in the Royal Palms resort, I enjoyed how cozy the resort and restaurant were.    We got there a little early and had to wait for a few minutes at the bar.  I ended up with a espressotini which was delicious and satisfied my caffeine need.  The bar scene and I guess dining scene was unique.  Definitely a much older crowd, lots of couples, and lots of people wanting attention.    The food at this place was excellent.  We started off with the cheese and prosciutto platter which was okay and we could have done without.  A huge loaf of bread and pesto dip was provided and was super yummy.  For my entree I had the fillet mignon with potatoes au gratin.  That steak was perfect and melted in my mouth.  My entree filled me up so much I ended up skipping dessert.  Service was great as well.  They took care of us but allowed us to have our space.   Oh and one final note, they have complimentary valet.

IcGsozC0sS4abyr9YfrZOQ.text: Great menu choices at the Sunday Brunch.  Buffet, a la Carte or both. Very good service. Only negative was that they let someone smoke a cigar outside at the front entrance and the smell started coming in.

Ai2HPbF8CoPMKZFz08tZUA.text: My husband and I had New Year's Eve dinner there. For the prices we paid (about $150+tax & tip per person), we expected better and more food. The food was just not that great. One of our dishes was cold, but they quickly replaced it after we complained. And the dessert was just not up to par. I only had a few bites and didn't want to eat more. So we paid like $300+tax and tip all together for not so great food.   Plus the crowd who ate there was stuffy. Most of the women who went there showed up either with a mink coat or a mink stole (and the restaurant told us the attire is resort casual). And don't bother trying to make casual conversation with the patrons there. Most likely they won't talk back.   Yes, like what the other Yelper said - it's a stuffy, pretentious, uncomfortable and mediocre place. If you want good food and good service - go next store to J & G Steakhouse at the Phoenician. We had some excellent food for very reasonable prices there!

dig2urre7uxbvMs8sFaGgQ.text: We had brunch on Sunday and it was great.  The place looks great and the food was deelish.  It's a bit pricy but the ingredients seems all top notch.  We'll try to hurry back.

UT-akvRGtVGxIjE9ScRBWg.text: Great eats at this joint. New York strip was awesome! Pear salad was bomb and service was superb. I'll be back march 10th!

3JOnfO66fdnKZ0cujX__Aw.text: I was accompanied by an out of town guest, last Saturday evening. Our waiter was Robert. He was so helpful to us in making our selections, and extremely attentive. We followed his recommendations and he was spot on!  We wanted two appetizers and to split the entree. We had the Beet Salad and the Corn Anglioti. Delicious!  The chef was doing a 10 oz. (Not kidding) rib eye. It was served on a bed of teeny tasty tender baby mushrooms, asparagus. Topped with a very light, almost fluffy, Bernaise (not heavy) and a bit of crab. Sprinkled around the plate were tiny, crunchy, coffee chips. So, If you took a bite of the steak (perfectly med-rare), mushrooms and coffee chips, it literally was an explosion in your mouth!  Such complimentary components that really worked. The chef even divided up the plate, including the steak, for sharing.  I could not finish my half, much to the delight of my friend. He was happy to finish.  To end, we had 3 scoops of their homemade ice cream, creatively served in a rectangular dish, with a thick slice of ice to fit the dish. Scoops were placed on the ice piece!  Loved it!  This place is classically Scottsdale, enveloped by the spectacular Royal Palms Resort. A leisurely meal in a truly beautiful setting.  My friend was impressed.

Wl_zdnOYoJQNbfTpjFnkgw.text: This past weekend we stayed at the Royal Palms....a beautiful place in Scottsdale.  Their restaurant certainly matched the ambience of the resort.  Dark, warm decor, rustic feel.  We were dining in a large group, so that may have knocked a star off my review, but I felt that for the level of the resort the restaurant was fair, not great.  We had the lobster bisque for starters, and it was ok....not a standout compared to others I have had.  My wife had the lobster tortellini and it was again good, not great....although the presentation was artful, it just lacked any wow factor in spicing, texture or even the basic preparation of the lobster (slightly overdone, not as succulent as it should have been).   I had the 21 day dry aged ribeye.  It was pretty good, cooked perfectly, but was a bit pricey.  The ribeye came with truffled grits and hamakua mushrooms which were ok.  There are better picks in nearby downtown Scottsdale, but if you enjoying this beautiful resort and don't feel like driving you can get a good dinner here.

mFnCLOgvigOAi756oOk_Yw.text: T. Cooks is one of my favorite restaurants in Scottsdale, and I don't know if it's because it's part of one of the nicest hotels there or what. I like the atmosphere and attentiveness of the wait staff, and I could drink by the gallon that pesto sauce thing they give you for the bread. I had the best gnocchi in the world there, but since their menu changes all the time, it's a crap shoot whether or not I'll ever have that again. I like it because since I'm so not into dressing up for dinner unless I have a super hot date, it's okay to go somewhat biz casual. The strawberry salad is good, and I can't even remember what I had for dessert, but whatever it was, it was delicious. People have complaints about the prices, but I say have business meetings there!

7IkgVf8SB21NII6n3uEm3w.text: My husband and I got engaged here a few years ago, we celebrate our anniversary here every year, and each year it has been amazing and has gotten better. This year, was by far, the best year yet. The new chef is amazing, far better than the previous one. The food pairings are amazing, never had foods that went so well together. Our waiter was great, he knew the menu and suggested amazing dishes.  The dishes are on the smaller side, but that is so you can have a full 3 course meal. I'm not big on trying new things, but this is the only place that I will try something new. Love coming out here, the atmosphere is impeccable, the singer the bar had, was not loud, she was singing at a very reasonable, soft level that made the experience that more enjoyable. I personally think the quality of food is worth the prices. I know that this isn't your Mimi's or Taco Bell, this is a nice, fancy place that we go to once or twice a year, so we don't mind forking over the cash :)

jIVRwkQQD_PGMGZmboPlIQ.text: Last night we went to spend the $150 gift certificate our daughter gave us a year ago---was not that excited to go.  Had eaten here a few times in the past but was never very impressed with the food.  And thanks to the reviews on Yelp still wasn't keen on going.  We went early to enjoy the happy hour which some had raved about.  I ordered the house martini, a vodka I had never heard of and surprisingly it was ok.  We had the tuna etutanesca, a "seared" tuna--it WAS NOT seared but tasty, the edamame, good, and the pretzel bites with a cold cheese fondue which had to be sent back to be warmed.  Wine selection is not good---when Mirasou is on the wine menu at such an upscale restaurant you have to wonder---at least I did.  Wasn't really hungry but decided to have dinner anyway to use up the certificate.  We started with Lobster Bisque, HORRIBLE!--wrong color, did not taste any lobster and the garnish was mussel I believe.  Wanted the grilled peach salad--no peaches available--so shared the Asian Pear Salad, and still had some left over.  It was ok.  We also shared the Carbonara, tasty.  I finished off with the gelato and coffee ---good.  So with tips and the food we ended up spending $15.00 out of pocket.  I love the atmosphere but definitely will not be going back on my dime.

jlMztnRmQIkN9c_W2cW5dA.text: I hadn't been to TCooks for a while because I hadn't been to PHX, but it was always one of my favorite places to eat in the area and I'm happy to report that I still feel the same.  The grounds are beautiful, the bar area is warm and inviting and the food is delicous.  I recommend sitting outside and highly recommend getting the lobster tortellini with lobster on top - a little rich (I'd like it better without the butter sauce I think), but just delectable.  They have a wonderful wine list too - extensive and not outrageously priced.     It will continue to be on my list of must visits when I'm in PHX!

ToZGW0CDo2zOLMmVJtJYng.text: Outstanding food and service.  Went in April while we were staying at the resort and am still thinking about my meal.  A slam dunk for my husband and I as he loves meat and I am a vegetarian and it is tricky to find a fine dining establishment that will create a real entree for a vegetarian (as opposed to a pasta dish or clumping 3 sides together).   The chef completely created a customized dish for me that included morel mushrooms.  It was divine!  My husband loved his as well.  Server was really personable and nice.  This really was a 5 star experience.

xD1wiPhrhIGR8b-qh7AkaA.text: We have eaten at T.Cook's several times and have never been dissappointed. This time the food was not up to par. The sweetbreads were little hard nuggets and the ribeye, which was ordered medium rare was either well done or medium. On the plus side the servers were pleasant and explained the menu well. It's not their fault that the food did not live up to the description

z33IJJCudOEbEvaK6imOuA.text: T. Cook's is like a cute little oasis haven in the desert.  Well, duh... I guess oasis's are only in deserts.  Or are they?  Well, whatever... this place is really cute.    This is actually a resort/hotel.  The outdoor area includes a little wishing pool/fountain, little nooks where one can rest in the shade and enjoy the view.  Love the flowers.  Yes, I took pictures, like the damn tourist I was.    The restaurant is really cute.  We came on a Sunday, so they have brunch.  I had the blueberry pancakes, which were very good.  The whipped cream on top was heavenly- so fresh and I could tell, freshly made.  My girlfriend had the lemon brioche french toast with a side of chicken sausage.  That was also very good.  The bellini's were standard, but the bloody mary's, delicious.  I was never a bloody mary girl, until my sister got me started... and now, I finally get it.  This was the right combination of tart, spicy, sweet, and vodka!  My mouth is watering right now.  Damn it.    The clientele here was 1. older 2. women.  A cute place to go with your family.  Also a cute place to go with the girls for lunch.  There's a little smoking room to the side, where (I think) you can smoke cigars.  Love that.  I also think this place would be great for a wedding reception, rehearsal dinner, or party.

9ZMR_uy9R_FRAVjWBg7nYQ.text: I do love to frequent the resorts for Sunday buffett and wanted to try something new so we decided to go to T. Cook's.  Pulling up to the Royal Palms, you are immediately engulfed in a different world, one of serenity and pure bliss.  We got to T. Cooks and our friends were on the patio.  It was a beautiful day to enjoy the wonderful Phoenix weather.  Immediately we were greated by Brad one of the nicest most friendly and accomodating servers I have ever encountered.  He was constantly provided high level service without being intrusive.  He made sure we were well tended to.  If it were him and service alone, this place would get a 10 star.  Now the food. Prices are reasonable for a resort.  Our table got the Pot Roast, Eggs Benedict on Foccaccia bread and the Red Velvet French Toast.  I would say 2/4 of us were happy with our food.  The french toast was a bit burned and didn't really taste like much.  The eggs benedict was good however a very small portion. Overall it wasn't bad but probably will never go back for brunch.  I hear the happy hour is good?!?

UfyE-rarzgPYLzSs4d09lg.text: Just a bland menu.  Two types of fish, steaks, pork chop, saffron pasta.  It is 5 star service yet food is no better than a strip mall chain.  Disappointed from what it used to be.  I had the Whole Roasted Loup De Mer.  No flavor just a plain tasting white fish.   I started with the Organic Corn Agnolotti which was very good.  It is just  three ravioli.   The beet salad was ok, but I wouldn't get it again.   I had the walnut ice cream with oatmeal tart.  It was dry.  I won't return with this menu.

mCNgA7tybSDB5IQT-02oTw.text: Had a wonderful dinner with friends. Paul our waiter was exceptional.  Beautiful setting and new exotic cats to look at as we left.

XRDrBcyoTEmJTmiuacJwug.text: My review would have been five stars except for two reasons: 1) No one answered the telephone at the restaurant or on overflow at the hotel when I called twice.  I finally got Elmi on the phone, and he took care of me, and couldn't have been more apologetic or gracious but, but I had already been frustrated by the experience, and 2) The layout of the dining room was not conducive to standing in line for one's brunch because we had to snake around pillars and people who were already seated, which I'm sure they didn't appreciate.  We had friends in from CT, and we used the Travelzoo discount deal.    The fresh seafood was to die for... I LOVED the crab claws and shrimp, and the beef was also excellent.  The salads were crisp and fresh, and those at our table who had personal omelets really enjoyed them.  Wish there were more interesting fresh, artisan breads to go with!    We were able to self-park, which we always prefer, and had a very enjoyable time at a lovely venue.

6V4Q7P-FIWbHoWTu0KNUKw.text: Wonderful ambiance food and wait staff. Sasha was so accommodating even thought there were large parties he made sure to take very good care of us. The creme brule is over the top delicious and the serving size is huge!  Great date night romantic spot or special occasion dinner. Will definitely return!

D8f8xz8nkhYv3FhO2y172w.text: Went here for a work Christmas lunch had a group of seven .. food is great here we did the humus and cheese and meat platter and we all got something from BLT to salad to salmon to scallops to clams to a slightly under cooked burger but over all good was amazing great presentation....we get tab and we leave on our well fed and happy...where the low ratings come from is after get back and we're logging our expense report when noticed a gratuity charge that was not mentioned at time of reservation or check out so when we called them to advise we also left a tip that needed to be canceled we were told there was no one to talk to. This was a Wednesday well before holidays so we called back for several days and have never been contacted so looks like we won't be goi

bdij9yzF1ZkE50papttMrw.text: Overall - we had a terrific experience. We had a large party and had planned ahead for the three-course meal with specialized menus. Everything was delicious. We enjoyed the Mix-up lounge as well. Great little room w/ a fireplace off to the side of the music was the perfect spot. One disappointment: given that we planned ahead for the event for a birthday party of 12 - they had us set up six seats to two round tables. Not only we were a bit squished, we weren't all together. Fortunately, they accommodated us by moving a few tables together - but only after we asked and only after other diners left. This should have been a no-brainer. Still recommended.

duBC9O7-pZgc7YPsE6pRAQ.text: I have to say that all of the food was perfectly prepared and delicious. My complaint is the time it took to get our food. 7:30 reservation and we didn't get our main course until 9:15, 1hr 45 minutes shows that they were over booked for what they can handle. For the price they get for dinner it seems they could manage their/my time better.   The fish special was trout with mashed potatoes, asparagus & hollandaise sauce. It was very tasty and perfectly prepared.  The seating outdoors is fabulous, comfortable w/ heaters when needed and very chic with great patio landscaping.

photos.caption: Photo of T Cook's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Apple Tart with caramel popcorn &amp; apple

Sn1qe4dI98_8KygPcIsPiA.text: This used to be a favorite weekend breakfast spot, but since they got the new chef it has unfortunately gone downhill. They used to have bottomless mimosas and amazing pancakes but they won't even serve those on Sunday's due to the seafood brunch buffet. We figured this out when we took out of town guests there...disappointing and super expensive!

fydD5PyEfTLWzFHzFWjtmg.text: Customer service here as in the whole of Royal Palms is nearly through the roof great, at times even bordering on obsequious. Service was not quite excellent, but it's really great. Had dinner here and ordered tasting menu ($40) and accompanying libations ($20). The tenderloin was pretty much the best tenderloin I've ever eaten. The beet salad was delicious and the cheesecake was thick and creamy. My bf had the antelope (!!) which he thought was great, cooked to perfection, tender and tasty.The accompanying drinks were interesting and fun, but I'm not a big drinker so I reached my limit pretty early.   I don't know about y'all who are complaining about portion sizes, portions are normal-sized and VERY filling. If you're used to strapping on the feedbag at a buffet, then you may be disappointed, but the bf was happily full and I left STUFFED and quite happy.   I highly recommend!

GH5MbQ9d_xOs_dR8cxLz_A.text: *Happy Hour Review* (This is at the Mix Up Bar - and I will post there, too - but it seems many don't know it's separate from T. Cooks, so I am reviewing here.)  Three words: Duck Confit Poutine - rich, delicious, large portion. The name says it all - and my pictures do not do it any justice!  Three more words: Lobster Corn Dogs - small plate with only 3 pieces - but incredibly well prepared, delicious and hey - lobster for $5.00!?!  Three more words: Half price bourbon! Two incredibly well crafted and incredibly generous Manhattans later, I was feeling no pain!  One of the best parts of PHX is the under-appreciated happy hour deals at some of our best resorts. Especially this time of year - there are great values to be had, at incredible prices!  Here's the Mix Up current specials menu: Daily - happy hour 4-7; $5.00 cocktails, beer, wine and lite bites. Tuesdays - Pizza & Punch $5 flatbreads, $6 signature punch cocktail of the day: 4:00 p.m. - 12:00 a.m. Women & Whiskey Wednesdays - 1/2 price ladies bourbon night: 4:00 p.m. - 12:00 a.m. Bourbon & Burgers Thursdays - $8 burger, 1/2 price bourbons: 4:00 p.m. - 12:00 a.m.  .Can't wait to go back!

1VYsgMgBm16QXDemmX2f9Q.text: Went to t cooks with my dad for Christmas Eve and was disappointed.   First time back since the re-opening.  Bread and appetizers were good. Was disappointed that we hadn't checked ahead of time to see if it was a pre fixe menu, but weren't too disappointed, until....  My dad ordered salmon and felt that it was severely undercooked. Asked a waiter (because ours was nowhere to be seen) if that was how the dish was supposed to be prepared. He said yes the salmon is typically prepared medium rare (like sashimi on the inside), but he would be happy to have the chef put it on for a bit longer.   While he was gone, our waitress came back, and when she asked why my dad no longer had his plate and we explained, she pursed her lips and seemed very disappointed in our attitude. She asked if my venison was cooked to my liking and I said yes.   A few minutes later the manager brought out the new plate of salmon and apologized for the mistake. We said it was no problem and asked again if that was the way the salmon was supposed to be prepared. The manager said absolutely not and he and the chef apologized for the mishap. When my dad cut into the new plate of salmon it had the same error. In the interest of not being difficult and getting on with the meal he didn't make a fuss about it and said it was fine. The manager looked at me inquisitively because he could tell my dad was not satisfied, but I apologetically said it was fine and he left.   Our waitress came back shortly and asked how the salmon was. My dad said it was still a bit underdone for his taste but it was fine. She said, "well, that's how I like mine, but I know some people prefer theirs overlooked." This was the most offensive part of the meal. When we are paying $88 a person, we don't care how our waitress prefers her meal, we prefer it to be cooked to our liking, i.e. cooked.  The dessert was fine but nothing to write home about. However, when we received our bill we were supremely disappointed to see that no discount had been added to our bill for the inconvenience of the mishap, especially with the manager knowing that even the re-cook was not satisfactory. For such an expensive meal at such a renowned restaurant, something should have been done to rectify the situation.  Furthermore, the waitress should never have given her condescending opinion of how she preferred her own fish cooked. It was odd that when I ordered the venison, she took care to ask if the typical medium rare preparation was acceptable for the meat while she did not inquire the same in regards to the fish, when it is highly rare to cook fish that way in a restaurant. I cannot imagine that other restaurant patrons have not had similar reactions to the fish if this is indeed, their standard preparation.   Overall, felt gypped, condescended to, and disappointed in what should have been a very special meal at one of the supposedly best restaurants at one of the best hotels in the city.

DbAkwEWNq-aBfcqHTcU6vg.text: Fantastic summer tasting menu at the cooks. Paired with very refreshing summer cocktails we watched a monsoon come in while Robert took care of everything. Don't forget to ask for the summer tasting menu!

JSJRyi1kTfqb8W2_ARdv2g.text: My partner and I came to the restaurant on Sunday the 24th of April. We had a drink at the bar before dinner and were impressed and liked the service of the bartender. The hostess was very nice when we checked in at the restaurant. She placed rose petals on our table which was a cute touch.  The poor review was mainly because of our waiter. He was very short with us. Didn't go over the menu like you would expect from a fine dining restaurant/resort. I don't know if it's because we are gay or if he just was in a bad mood but it was just poor service. We even heard another waiter ask their table if they could bring their valet ticket to the valet. Our service we just poor.  The food was good though. We did enjoy that. The flat iron steak wasn't really to my liking. Too dry. But the risotto was really good.

EjO2T387GyL3C-EDv8lyGg.text: A friend and I went to T Cook's last night for restaurant week. We had been wanting to try this place for a long time and were excited to go. This restaurant is valet only (which, if you know me, you know I have a problem with), so we dropped the car with the friendly valet and headed in. The grounds of this hotel/restaurant are beautiful and very well maintained. We were seated at this table with odd high back chairs that make you feel somewhat secluded from the rest of the restaurant. This would be nice except it seemed that it also secluded us from timely service. We were seated and given the regular menu and left for a long time. We had to ask for the restaurant week menu when the waiter (finally) came back. Not sure why they didn't bring out the menu originally... did they think if they didn't provide the restaurant week menu more people would order off the regular menu (when most of the people were probably there for RW). Anyway, our meal took a looooooong time, with many long pauses between ordering and courses. Otherwise, the waiter was pleasant enough. I started the meal with the corn bisque, which was very rich, creamy and tasty. It was easily the best part of the meal. My friend had the greens with the strawberries, and this was tasty as well. The mains were far less impressive. I had the saffron pappardelle and my friend had the chicken. The pappardelle was alright, but tasted sort of plain considering the ingredients. The lamb was not showcased, the mint it had on it was so minimal you couldn't taste it, and overall it tasted like something you could easily make at home. It also came out luke warm and the ricotta they put on it was ice cold. The chicken looked amazing, but also came out luke warm and had an odd flavor... sort of like a cleanser scent... it was odd. The chicken was sliced and lost any juiciness it may have had when cooked. Though neither dish was terrible, neither tasted like it came from a high end, expensive restaurant. I'm not sure why they chose to showcase these items on their RW menu, but I hope this isn't the best they have to offer, because it wasn't very impressive. The dessert presentation was beautiful... this place really excels in presentation.... but again, it didn't have that 'yummy' factor that is so important in a dessert. I had the chocolate torte, which was fun and had some great garnishes (the pretzel ice cream was surprisingly savory and tasty... the popcorn brittle stuff was awesome), but the torte itself wasn't that great. It was a milk chocolate and would have tasted much better if it were a dark chocolate... it didn't have that rich chocolatey flavor that you envision when you order a torte. My friend had the cheesecake, which was good, but again, nothing special. Overall, I probably wouldn't come back here considering the mediocre nature of the food and the price.   PS when I was leaving, the valet went to get my car and brought someone else's car out.... that's a pretty big mistake... what's the point of valet if they're going to give your car to other people.... eeek. They did apologize and were nice, but I would be pretty upset if someone drove off in my car.

MASQHXbR9aMmZ1ORNt9c-g.text: Wait this can't be T Cooks who has gone through three or four chefs??. The menu is pretentious. Wait we are in Phoenix. The fish choices were exotic and small for the price. The lamb venison was average and the other fish was average. Had to ask for bread and when that was gone had to ask not offered another. The restaurant setting has always been when Fred first did and subsequent owner if one if the best. Wine was great. Desert seemed average. Time to sit back and ask myself for $100 a meal I should have gone elsewhere. Service was good. Big event on the grass. Must of taxed the kitchen..

4kuxokY6mk-O1bu7PwpmcQ.text: I loved everything about our evening here.  My Hubby brought me as a Mother's day gift.  Everything was amazing.  The beautiful resort really made it special.  The food was outstanding.  The service was perfect.    We ordered the bison tar tar, and I really loved it.  The portion was huge, we couldn't finish it.  I had a martinez, it was made great! I had the short ribs with bone marrow and my Hubby had the chicken with sausage.  I loved my meal, it had so many flavors, the vanilla onions took it to another level, and the marrow, wow! I tasted my Hubby's meal and it was very good.  I would say we would chose something else next time, but it was still great.  The sausage was not that good.  We also had the chocolate dessert, I would pass on this next time. The cake was not my thing and part of the flavor wasn't what I dream of when I dream chocolate dreams :) I would love to try the apple fritters maybe.    I am excited to go back also because they give you a surprise gift you open on your next visit...  I can't wait to come back and just happy hour it, the bar was beautiful and the music was so impressive.

hKtXF7ywrgN59gxGb5I1_A.text: Recently went for dinner at one of our favorite resorts in Scottsdale. The valet service was outstanding, however our dining experience was mediocre. One waiter handling six tables resulted in very slow service. The menu selection was the same as last year with no real improvements. So five star resort with a three star dining experience. Hopefully management will improve the quality and dining experience of the restaurant. It is surprising to me that management doesn't seem to care about the amount of very poor reviews they are receiving... for this once great restaurant. Very disconcerting.

3UtlC_JWTOnoDNafwa3Dgg.text: Love this place!  I save it for the special days after I spend all day in the spa.  All my friends who come to visit and want a nice, relaxing night out in a peacefilled location I point them to T Cooks!

CM32YxazQM8PYwJRCGlvrA.text: Went here for the first time last night with some friends and enjoyed the experience. Our server was nice and very knowledgeable about the menu. The pesto spread for the bread is so fresh and delicious. I had the mushroom risotto and my boyfriend had the filet, both very good. We shared the chocolate silk for dessert, also great. It is pricey, but the food is of high quality and worth it. I'll definitely be back to try more menu items.

7LOorP6J8Z8sNtxqZXzl_Q.text: The atmosphere is warm and pleasant. Nice patio with heaters if it's even a little cool. Lots of plants outside and a nice fireplace in the main dining room.  The crowd tends to be on the mature side.  The service is good and friendly,  7 out of 10.  The food is pricey. The wine list is extensive,  but possibly the most overpriced. Try the $20 wine sampler - 3 half glassesof your choice. The lobster bisque was a little bitter for my taste but my petite wife loved hers and finished mine.  The $45 new york strip was ordered medium rare and came out medium, same is True for my wife's beef tenderloin. The presentation was very nice. Despite it being overcooked, it was delicious with a good medley of flavors.   Overall,  it was good but I'd go elsewhere for the money.

WUNoRPRNjuU939UW_6eHxw.text: Overall 3.5 stars Highs - Desserts, cheesecake and ice cream  Menu was surprisingly limited.  Two fish, two beefs and lamb.  Where was the fowl?  Veggie?  The octopus was excellent and the scallops with pork belly was good too.  So why the 3 star?  Mostly service expectations not met.  My host was told over the phone they offered corkage, we arrive with bottles to be told no.  We had an early reservation, 5:30p and the service was unusually rushed.  Likely as they were try to turn the table three times that night?  My partners flank steak was awesome, especially the duck fat chips.  Dessert was the highlight, while the flourless chocolate was nice, it was very rich and heavy.  The salted Carmel ice cream was fantastic.  I feel like this restaurant is trying to accommodate more tables than it can really handle.  If so they should lower their prices to raise the rating in my book.  Not bad mind you, but I've had better in Phoenix.

lRhz1xAK5LZx310fSemUDQ.text: I really enjoy T cooks. The food is always great and seasonal. The decor is beautiful. The staff is all very attentive even in the bar next door. The Spanish octopus is by far the best I've had anywhere. The bottle prices are decent as well.
